original: bcom ldan 'das de yang yang dag pa'i tha snyad la ltos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang yang dag pa'i tha snyad la ltos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Bhagavat, moreover, in dependence on correct convention, is twofold, by way of the division of the states of cause and effect.

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The state of cause is the state of the Bodhisattva.

original: de'i dus su yang thams cad rjes su dpag pas rtogs par byed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su dpag pa thog mar gsungs so //üîΩlung rigs dag gis rnam dpyod pa //
analyzed: de'i dus su yang thams cad rjes su dpag pas rtogs par byed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su dpag pa thog mar gsungs so // lung rigs dag gis rnam dpyod pa //
translated: At that time, because he causes realization through inference, the Bhagavat first taught inference.üîΩHe is called the Teacher, the one who is intent on the welfare of the world.

original: zhes rjes su dpag pa'i le'ur gang 'chad par gyur pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes rjes su dpag pa'i le'ur gang 'chad par gyur pa bstan pa ni /
translated: In the chapter on inference, he is called the one who is intent on the welfare of the world.

original: 'gro la phan bzhed ston pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du 'bras bu'i gnas skabs @4a * //
analyzed: 'gro la phan bzhed ston pa zhes bya'o // de bzhin du 'bras bu'i gnas skabs @4a * //
translated: He is called the Teacher, the one who is intent on the welfare of the world.

original: ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don dag phul du byung ba'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don dag phul du byung ba'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, the state of effect is twofold, by way of the division of the highest of one‚Äôs own aim and the highest of others‚Äô aim.

original: de la rang gi don phul du byung ba ni thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad phyin ci ma log par mngon du mdzad pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi rang bzhin no //üîΩrnam pa du ma'i thabs mang po zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni /üîΩbde gshegs skyob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi don phul du byung ba ni thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad phyin ci ma log par mngon du mdzad pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi rang bzhin no // rnam pa du ma'i thabs mang po zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba bstan pa ni / bde gshegs skyob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of one's own aim is the nature of direct intuition, because it is the realization of all aspects without error.üîΩThe perfection of others' aims is the nature of inference, because the Lord teaches others the path just as he has realized it.

original: gzhan gyi don phul du byung ba yang bcom ldan 'das ni de ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i lam gzhan rnams la ston par mdzad pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phul du byung ba yang bcom ldan 'das ni de ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i lam gzhan rnams la ston par mdzad pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The perfection of others' aims is the nature of inference, because the Lord teaches others the path just as he has realized it.

original: de la rang gi don phul du byung ba rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir thog mar mngon sum mo //
analyzed: de la rang gi don phul du byung ba rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir thog mar mngon sum mo //
translated: The perfection of one's own aim is the root, hence it is direct intuition.

original: de'i bang du gyur pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pas bsgrub bya ji lta bas khyab pa'i rtags dran par byed pa nyid kho nas tshig gi tha snyad la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i 'og tu gzhan gyi
analyzed: de'i bang du gyur pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pas bsgrub bya ji lta bas khyab pa'i rtags dran par byed pa nyid kho nas tshig gi tha snyad la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i 'og tu gzhan gyi
translated: And since inference for others is also a means of valid cognition, it is only by recalling the reason that pervades the probandum that one applies the verbal convention.

original: don gyi rjes su dpag pa bsgrub par 'dod /
analyzed: don gyi rjes su dpag pa bsgrub par 'dod /
translated: Therefore, after the inference for oneself, one wishes to establish the inference for others.

original: nas de bstan pa ni skyob la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nas de bstan pa ni skyob la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is ‚Äúfor the sake of protecting others.‚Äù

original: tshad ma gsum po 'di'i yang spyi'i mtshan nyid med na /
analyzed: tshad ma gsum po 'di'i yang spyi'i mtshan nyid med na /
translated: If these three means of valid cognition did not have a general definition,

original: rig byed la sogs pa tshad ma ma yin pa mtshan nyid dang bral ba can mi rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir le'u dang pos te de bstan pa ni tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig byed la sogs pa tshad ma ma yin pa mtshan nyid dang bral ba can mi rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir le'u dang pos te de bstan pa ni tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then one would not understand that the Vedas and so on, which are not means of valid cognition, are devoid of definition. Therefore, in order to establish the general definition of means of valid cognition, the first chapter is composed. The teaching of that is ‚Äúthat which is a means of valid cognition.‚Äù

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba'i tshig dag gi snga ma dang phyi ma'i nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba'i tshig dag gi snga ma dang phyi ma'i nges pa ni med do //
translated: There is no definite sequence of earlier and later among the words that distinguish the general definition.

original: rnam par phye ba dag gis tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa ni tshad ma rnam par nges pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba dag gis tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa ni tshad ma rnam par nges pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The exclusion of non-valid cognition by means of the specific is just as in the Ascertainment of Valid Cognition.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa'am rnam par dbye ba 'di nyid du rnam par gcod pa ni /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa'am rnam par dbye ba 'di nyid du rnam par gcod pa ni /
translated: The exclusion or differentiation of non-valid cognition by means of the general characteristic is shown here by the words

original: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par dbye ba ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par dbye ba ston par 'gyur te /
translated: It is twofold, etc.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold because it is a part of the specific characteristic.

original: des na dang po nyid ces bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: des na dang po nyid ces bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: First of all means definitely.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par dbye bas bzhag pa dag med na shin tu nges pa'i ngo bo rtogs par 'dod cing rtogs par byed par 'dod par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par dbye bas bzhag pa dag med na shin tu nges pa'i ngo bo rtogs par 'dod cing rtogs par byed par 'dod par yang mi nus so //
translated: Because if there were no establishment by means of differentiation, it would not be possible to understand or to make others understand the nature of valid cognition as it is ascertained.

original: 'di lta bu'i tshad ma de la phyag btsal nas bshad par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i tshad ma de la phyag btsal nas bshad par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Having paid homage to such a valid cognition, it is to be explained - this is the connection.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo bo gzhan gyi 'khrul pa sel ba 'dir bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo bo gzhan gyi 'khrul pa sel ba 'dir bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavat, who is the essence of the conventional and the ultimate, who is the dispeller of the error of others, is to be established here.üîΩBecause he has attained the perfection of qualities through the complete abandonment of all stains together with their propensities, he is excellent. Because he has realized all things nondually, he is the essence of direct perception.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i dri ma thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i phyir yon tan @4b phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pas phul du byung ba dngos po ma lus pa gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa'i phyir mngon sum pa'i bdag nyid can ni don dam par
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i dri ma thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i phyir yon tan @4b phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pas phul du byung ba dngos po ma lus pa gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa'i phyir mngon sum pa'i bdag nyid can ni don dam par
translated: In the ultimate,

original: ro // kun rdzob tu yang de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi tshad ma yin par shes pa'i don du de la 'khrul pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang tshig gi ngo bo rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dbye bas bstan te
analyzed: ro // kun rdzob tu yang de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi tshad ma yin par shes pa'i don du de la 'khrul pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang tshig gi ngo bo rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dbye bas bstan te
translated: and in the conventional, he is the valid knowledge that is in accord with that. In order to understand the meaning, he is taught through the categories of the nonerroneous conception and the nature of speech, which are inference for oneself and inference for others.

original: / des na rtsig pa la sogs pa las byung bas bstan pa rnams nyid la yang kho bo cag yid ches pa med do zhes zer ba'i gzhan gyi 'khrul pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: / des na rtsig pa la sogs pa las byung bas bstan pa rnams nyid la yang kho bo cag yid ches pa med do zhes zer ba'i gzhan gyi 'khrul pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since they are taught by means of walls, etc., we have no confidence in them.

original: gang gi phyir mngon du mdzad pa der nges pa'i gtan tshigs nges pa de rtog pa po'am tshig la rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams yid mi ches par mi rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon du mdzad pa der nges pa'i gtan tshigs nges pa de rtog pa po'am tshig la rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams yid mi ches par mi rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not right for those who are doubtful about the words or who are endowed with discursive thought to be doubtful about the reason which is certain in that which is manifested.

original: lhag ma ni 'di la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni le'u'i go rims so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'di la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni le'u'i go rims so //
translated: The rest is the same here also.

original: de la tshad mar gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i dang po'i phyed ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshad mar gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i dang po'i phyed ni bstod pa'o //
translated: The first half of the verse, ‚ÄúBecause of being a valid means of knowledge,‚Äù is praise.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.

original: tshad ma grub pa 'chad par byed pa yin gyi slob dpon gyis gzhung bshad pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni rnam 'grel mdzad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //üîΩde la yang gtan tshigs ni rtog ge ngan 'khrul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa 'chad par byed pa yin gyi slob dpon gyis gzhung bshad pa'i phyir ma yin pa ni rnam 'grel mdzad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //üîΩde la yang gtan tshigs ni rtog ge ngan 'khrul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the one who is to be trusted.üîΩThe meaning of the commentary is that it is the one who explains the establishment of valid means of knowledge, not the author of the treatise, who is the

original: gzhan yang kha cig bcom ldan 'das mar me bzhin du mya ngan las 'das kyang tshad ma nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang kha cig bcom ldan 'das mar me bzhin du mya ngan las 'das kyang tshad ma nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Moreover, some believe that the Blessed One is like a lamp, and that he is a valid cognition because he is in nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de la tshad mar gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la tshad mar gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúHe is a valid cognition,‚Äù and so on.

original: skyon med pa'i dngos po dor bar rigs pa ma yin te mya ngan las 'das pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skyon med pa'i dngos po dor bar rigs pa ma yin te mya ngan las 'das pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not reasonable to discard the entity that is faultless, like nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang ste de bstan pa ni bde gshegs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang ste de bstan pa ni bde gshegs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Likewise, it is the wisdom of omniscience, and the teaching of that is ‚Äúthe Sugata.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin yang dngos po'i rgyun gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir mar khu la sogs pa zad pa'i mar me bzhin du zad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin yang dngos po'i rgyun gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir mar khu la sogs pa zad pa'i mar me bzhin du zad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Even though it has that nature, is it not extinguished, like a lamp that is extinguished when the oil and wick are used up, because there is no cause for the continuity of the entity?

original: phan bzhed pa ston pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phan bzhed pa ston pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe teacher who is benevolent,‚Äù

original: 'dis kyang rgyu brtan po gzhan du med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rgyu brtan po gzhan du med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: and this also teaches that there is no other stable cause.

original: 'on te de lta na yang 'ga' zhig nye bar sbyor bar mi byed cing 'dor la /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na yang 'ga' zhig nye bar sbyor bar mi byed cing 'dor la /
translated: Even so, some do not apply themselves and discard it.

original: 'gal ba du ba'am rang nyid skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba du ba'am rang nyid skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is contradictory for it to be both smoke and itself arising,

original: tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the root text states, ‚Äúit is valid cognition.‚Äù

original: skye ba thams cad du phan pa nye bar bstan pas phan btags pa yin na /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad du phan pa nye bar bstan pas phan btags pa yin na /
translated: If it is helpful in all cases of arising, then it is helpful.

original: de don med pa can ma yin gyi lan cig byung ba'i phan btags pa byas pa des kyang dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de don med pa can ma yin gyi lan cig byung ba'i phan btags pa byas pa des kyang dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If it is not pointless, then what is the purpose of the help that it provides just once?

original: mi rigs te phan gdags par bya ba mtha' med pa la phan gdags pa yang mtha' med pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes @5a * //
analyzed: mi rigs te phan gdags par bya ba mtha' med pa la phan gdags pa yang mtha' med pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes @5a * //
translated: It is illogical to say that because there is no end to those who are to be helped, there is no end to those who help them, and therefore the purpose of the Blessed One‚Äôs appearance is to help all living beings.

original: kyang dam bcas pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: kyang dam bcas pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is because he has also made the vow to help all living beings.

original: de yang ma rdzogs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid kyang yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma rdzogs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid kyang yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, since that vow is not fulfilled, the Blessed One‚Äôs appearance is not complete.

original: de bstan pa ni tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching of that is called ‚Äúvalid cognition.‚Äù

original: de la yang 'gal ba med par bstan pa ni yang dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'gal ba med par bstan pa ni yang dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that there is no contradiction in that is called ‚Äúcorrect.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa la yang dag pha ma yin pas gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa la yang dag pha ma yin pas gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since what is correct is not incorrect, it is not invalidated.

original: nya phyis kyi shes pa la dngul gyi shes pas gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nya phyis kyi shes pa la dngul gyi shes pas gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: The consciousness of mother-of-pearl is not invalidated by the consciousness of silver.

original: yang dag pa la gnod par byed pa yang dag pa yin par ni mthong ste grang ba la sreg byed lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa la gnod par byed pa yang dag pa yin par ni mthong ste grang ba la sreg byed lta bu'o //
translated: And it is seen that what is real can invalidate what is real, as heat can burn.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: So too here, the meditative development of the counteragent will occur.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: gtan du 'gal ba ma yin gyi skad cig de la 'gal ba slar yang 'byung ba'i phyir te /üîΩde bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gtan du 'gal ba ma yin gyi skad cig de la 'gal ba slar yang 'byung ba'i phyir te / de bstan pa ni /
translated: because there is no permanent incompatibility, since what is incompatible in one moment arises again subsequently.üîΩThis is what is being taught.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Protector,

original: rgyun gyis gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyun gyis gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is: he who abides in a continuum.

original: sprul pa nye bar bsdu ba tsam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bstan kyang thams cad du rnam par rgyal ba po bcom ldan 'das ni 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa nye bar bsdu ba tsam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bstan kyang thams cad du rnam par rgyal ba po bcom ldan 'das ni 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: Although the Lord, the Victorious One, is shown to pass into final nirvƒÅ·πáa merely by withdrawing his emanation, he abides for as long as sa·πÉsƒÅra lasts.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das ni rang gi rang nyid rgyu las dbang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma nyid kyi ye shes skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das ni rang gi rang nyid rgyu las dbang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma nyid kyi ye shes skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavat himself is the valid knowledge that is the nature of the sense faculties and so on, arisen from his own cause, his own wisdom.

original: yon tan la sogs rgyu gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs rgyu gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not from other causes such as qualities.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid du nges pa med pa las na tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid du nges pa med pa las na tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: If he existed, it would be ascertained that he exists, and if he did not exist, it would be ascertained that he does not exist.

original: de tsam la ma yin na rgyu gzhan gyi skyon yin par nges par byed pa yin no zhes gzhan la ston to //
analyzed: de tsam la ma yin na rgyu gzhan gyi skyon yin par nges par byed pa yin no zhes gzhan la ston to //
translated: If he were not just that, it would be ascertained that the fault is in other causes.

original: ci'i phyir yon tan dang ldan pa'i dbang po rgyu ma yin pa ni rjes su dpag pa la mi snang ba'i phyir te gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa na tshul gsum pa nyid du nges pa las skye ba yin gyi yon tan de las ni ma yin
analyzed: ci'i phyir yon tan dang ldan pa'i dbang po rgyu ma yin pa ni rjes su dpag pa la mi snang ba'i phyir te gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa na tshul gsum pa nyid du nges pa las skye ba yin gyi yon tan de las ni ma yin
translated: Why is it that the sense faculties endowed with qualities are not the cause? Because it does not appear in inference. Because when inferring, it arises from the ascertainment of the trimodal criterion, not from those qualities,

original: te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because there is no ascertainment.

original: / mngon sum yang shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni cig shos rnams so //
analyzed: / mngon sum yang shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni cig shos rnams so //
translated: and the other is that direct perception is a cause of valid cognition because it is a cause of knowledge, but nothing else is.üîΩOthers say that the eye ointment, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re mig sman la sogs pas yon tan bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mig sman la sogs pas yon tan bskyed pa yin te /
translated: generate the quality,

original: de skyes pa nas brtsams nas yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de skyes pa nas brtsams nas yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: but it does not exist from the time it is generated.

original: de'i dbang po yang tshad ma skyed par byed pa snang yang de la yon tan rnams ni med de rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang po yang tshad ma skyed par byed pa snang yang de la yon tan rnams ni med de rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the sense faculty that generates valid cognition appears, but the quality does not exist there because there is no cause.

original: skye bas thob pa'i rab rib can gyi shes pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i rab rib can gyi shes pa ji ltar yin /
translated: How is it for the knowledge of one who is born blind?

original: de la mig sman la sogs pa'i sbyor bas skyon bsal bas dbang po nyid tshad mar gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: de la mig sman la sogs pa'i sbyor bas skyon bsal bas dbang po nyid tshad mar gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the sense faculty itself becomes valid cognition by the application of eye ointment, etc. that removes the fault,

original: sbyor bas skyon bsal bas yon tan skye bar byed pa de rnams las chad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor bas skyon bsal bas yon tan skye bar byed pa de rnams las chad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: then the quality is not valid cognition because the application that removes the fault generates the quality.

original: @5b 'di la tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang rab rib 'joms pa'i sbyor ba zhes kyang thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @5b 'di la tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang rab rib 'joms pa'i sbyor ba zhes kyang thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a valid cognition, and because it is said to be a ‚Äúpractice that destroys eye disease.‚Äù

original: rtog pa'i nyes pa du ma de rnams kyi skyon sel bar byed cing yon tan yang skyed par byed la /
analyzed: rtog pa'i nyes pa du ma de rnams kyi skyon sel bar byed cing yon tan yang skyed par byed la /
translated: It is the many faults of conceptualization that are eliminated, and it is also the many good qualities that are generated.

original: de'i phyir dbang po nyid tshad ma yin zhing tshad ma ma yin pa yang yin pa de las 'byung ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po nyid tshad ma yin zhing tshad ma ma yin pa yang yin pa de las 'byung ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties are valid cognitions and are not valid cognitions. They do not arise from that,

original: gzhan la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa yin te /
translated: but depend on something else.

original: 'di gzhan la ltos par yang mthong ba ni yon tan dam pa dang 'brel pa'i mig la zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa lta bu ste der yang yon tan la mi brten pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di gzhan la ltos par yang mthong ba ni yon tan dam pa dang 'brel pa'i mig la zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa lta bu ste der yang yon tan la mi brten pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is seen that they depend on something else. For example, the eye that is connected with the highest quality sees two moons. There, it is not that it does not depend on the quality,

original: tshad ma yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: but it is not a valid cognition. This is what is taught.

original: 'jig rten yang gang ji ltar rtogs pa de de bzhin du rjes su bsgrub ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang gang ji ltar rtogs pa de de bzhin du rjes su bsgrub ste /
translated: The world also is what is understood, and it is established just as it is understood.

original: der yang gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der yang gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: There also, it does not depend on something else.

original: gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were otherwise,

original: gzhan du yang dogs pa de lta na yang gzhan la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du yang dogs pa de lta na yang gzhan la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Even if there were such a doubt, it would depend on another.

original: tha snyad pa yang yul la yongs su mi gcod cing rab tu 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad pa yang yul la yongs su mi gcod cing rab tu 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: And the conventional does not operate by way of determination of the object.

original: yongs su bcad pa la yang gzhan la ltos pa ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: yongs su bcad pa la yang gzhan la ltos pa ci zhig dgos /
translated: And what need is there for dependence on determination?

original: slu bar dogs pa gzhan la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: slu bar dogs pa gzhan la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the doubt is dependent on another, the doubt that it is deceptive,

original: de lta na yang slu bar byed pa'i rgyu rnams nyid ni ltos pa can yin la mi slu ba nyid du rtogs pas nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang slu bar byed pa'i rgyu rnams nyid ni ltos pa can yin la mi slu ba nyid du rtogs pas nges pa yin no //
translated: then the causes of deception are themselves dependent, and the certainty that it is nondeceptive is established.

original: rig byed ni rang nyid tshad ma yin te /üîΩde yang / rang nyid tshad ma thams cad kyi //
analyzed: rig byed ni rang nyid tshad ma yin te / de yang / rang nyid tshad ma thams cad kyi //
translated: The Vedas are valid cognitions in themselves.üîΩAnd it is taught:

original: tshad ma nyid du nges pa ste //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du nges pa ste //
translated: All valid cognitions are valid cognitions in themselves.

original: rang nyid yod pa min pa ste //
analyzed: rang nyid yod pa min pa ste //
translated: They are not valid cognitions in themselves

original: gang na'ang yod ba ma yin no //üîΩzhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang na'ang yod ba ma yin no // zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: anywhere at all.

original: gzhan gyi la ni de 'dra ba'i shes pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi la ni de 'dra ba'i shes pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not reasonable for others to be like that, because there is no cause for such a consciousness.

original: mig gis lan cig gzugs mngon du byas pas mthong ba dus yang gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gis lan cig gzugs mngon du byas pas mthong ba dus yang gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The eye sees the form that is directly perceived by the eye, but it does not see at another time.

original: rgyu nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause is ascertained.üîΩMoreover,

original: de yang / tshad ma nyid ni gcig gis kyang //
analyzed: de yang / tshad ma nyid ni gcig gis kyang //
translated: By one valid cognition,

original: thams cad mkhyen par gang gis brtags //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par gang gis brtags //
translated: How can one cognize the omniscient one?

original: nges pa'i mig gis ro la sogs //
analyzed: nges pa'i mig gis ro la sogs //
translated: By the valid cognition of the eye,

original: thams cad shes par bya bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad shes par bya bar 'gyur //
translated: One can know all tastes.

original: zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught.

original: de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, the valid cognition that realizes that does not exist,

original: gang gis gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i rgyur brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i rgyur brtag par bya ste /
translated: By what can one cognize the cause that is not tenable elsewhere?üîΩMoreover,

original: de yang / re zhig da ltar kun mkhyen gyi //
analyzed: de yang / re zhig da ltar kun mkhyen gyi //
translated: First, the omniscient one

original: bdag la sogs pa ma mthong ste //üîΩphyogs gcig na yang yod par ni //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa ma mthong ste // phyogs gcig na yang yod par ni //
translated: Does not see the self and so on.üîΩAlso, because there is no evidence

original: rtags med phyir na dpag bya min //
analyzed: rtags med phyir na dpag bya min //
translated: For existing in one part, it is not to be inferred.

original: zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught.

original: rig byed kyang tshad mar mthong ba'i phyir cung zad kyang brtag par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: rig byed kyang tshad mar mthong ba'i phyir cung zad kyang brtag par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: Also, because the Vedas are seen to be valid, they are not to be investigated at all.

original: mi mthong par cung zad kyang dpyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: mi mthong par cung zad kyang dpyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The Analysts say: Do not analyze anything at all without seeing it.

original: 'di la la @6a * //üîΩgdab pa ni tshad mar 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la la @6a * // gdab pa ni tshad mar 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, some say:

original: re zhig rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa nyid du nges pa las skye ba yin gyi gzhan yon tan las ni ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: re zhig rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa nyid du nges pa las skye ba yin gyi gzhan yon tan las ni ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: The ascertainment of the three modes is the cause of inference, but it is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that newly realizes its object.üîΩThis is illogical because it is a quality of valid knowledge.

original: de nyid yon tan yin pa'i phyir de ma gtogs pa tshul gsum pa tsam ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin pa skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid yon tan yin pa'i phyir de ma gtogs pa tshul gsum pa tsam ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin pa skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The ascertainment of the three modes alone, which is not a valid cognition, generates a valid cognition that newly realizes its object.

original: 'di ltar / skul byed sogs par skyes ba'i blo //üîΩtshad ma yin te skyon bral rgyus //üîΩbskyed phyir rtags dang yid ches pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skul byed sogs par skyes ba'i blo // tshad ma yin te skyon bral rgyus // bskyed phyir rtags dang yid ches pa'i //
translated: For example, the mind that ascertains that Devadatta exists in the east is not a valid cognition, but the mind that ascertains that Devadatta exists in the east, which is generated from that, is a valid cognition.üîΩSimilarly, the mind that ascertains that Devadatta exists in the east, which is generated from the valid cognition that ascertains that Devadatta exists in the east, is not a valid cognition, but the mind that ascertains that Devadatta exists in the east, which is generated from that, is a valid cognition.

original: tshig dang dbang po'i shes pa bzhin //üîΩzhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshig dang dbang po'i shes pa bzhin //üîΩzhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the same way, the ascertainment of the three modes is not a valid cognition, but the inference that is generated from that is a valid cognition.üîΩThe ascertainment of the three modes is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that newly realizes its object.

original: 'di la skyon dang bral ba'i rgyus bskyed pa nyid kyi nges pa med kyang 'di las shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la skyon dang bral ba'i rgyus bskyed pa nyid kyi nges pa med kyang 'di las shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Although there is no certainty that this is produced by a cause free from error, it is still the case that consciousness arises from it.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i tshul gsum par nges pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i tshul gsum par nges pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a cause of inference that ascertains the three modes in a nonerroneous way.

original: 'on kyang tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir dbang po rnams la yang yon tan du brtags pa de ma nyams par mtshungs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir dbang po rnams la yang yon tan du brtags pa de ma nyams par mtshungs pa kho na yin no //
translated: However, since it is not a cause of valid knowledge, the imputation of the quality of being a valid cognition to the sense faculties is not undermined.

original: yang mig sman la sogs pa'i sbyor bas skyon med pa yin gyi yon tan ni med de zhes gang smras pa de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang mig sman la sogs pa'i sbyor bas skyon med pa yin gyi yon tan ni med de zhes gang smras pa de yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that the sense faculties are faultless due to the application of eye medicine and so on, but they are not endowed with any quality.

original: gal te dbang po tsam tshad ma skyed par byed na ni thams cad du skyed par byed par 'gyur te rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang po tsam tshad ma skyed par byed na ni thams cad du skyed par byed par 'gyur te rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the sense faculties alone were to produce valid knowledge, then they would always produce valid knowledge, because they always exist.

original: snang ba la sogs pas khyad par bskyed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pas khyad par bskyed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they produce valid knowledge by generating a special state of the object,

original: de lta na gzhan nyid las tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gzhan nyid las tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then valid knowledge would arise from something other than the sense faculties.

original: de yang / nyi ma'i zer gyis zil non phyir //
analyzed: de yang / nyi ma'i zer gyis zil non phyir //
translated: because the sun‚Äôs rays overpower them,

original: mig gi nus pa 'chor ba ni //üîΩrim gyis rim gyis de bzhin du //
analyzed: mig gi nus pa 'chor ba ni // rim gyis rim gyis de bzhin du //
translated: the power of the eyeüîΩis gradually lost.üîΩBut when one looks at them,

original: bltas nas gsal bar 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes bstan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bltas nas gsal bar 'gyur ba yin // zhes bstan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the clarity returns.

original: shes pa nyid ni yon tan dang skyon dag gis bskyed par bya ba ma yin gyi yon tan dang ldan pa dang skyon dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid ni yon tan dang skyon dag gis bskyed par bya ba ma yin gyi yon tan dang ldan pa dang skyon dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not produced by either good qualities or faults, but the sense faculty is endowed with good qualities or faults.

original: de dag med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it arises even when they do not exist,üîΩthe consciousness that arises from the sense faculty alone, even if it is faulty, is valid knowledge, because it is not distinguished with regard to its function.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by cataracts sees such things as floating hairs, but it is not valid knowledge.

original: dbang po tsam las byung ba skyon dang ldan pa yang bya ba la bye brag med pa'i phyir shes pa bzhin du tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩdbang po goms pa las byung ba'i zin po ni lugs la sogs pa rnams la bya ba byed pa yang mthong ste /
analyzed: dbang po tsam las byung ba skyon dang ldan pa yang bya ba la bye brag med pa'i phyir shes pa bzhin du tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro // dbang po goms pa las byung ba'i zin po ni lugs la sogs pa rnams la bya ba byed pa yang mthong ste /
translated: The visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.

original: de yang / goms pas phyir zhing zin por gyur //üîΩsngo ma rnams ni mjug sdud cing //
analyzed: de yang / goms pas phyir zhing zin por gyur //üîΩsngo ma rnams ni mjug sdud cing //
translated: The visual consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that is affected by the power of meditation sees such things as skeletons, but it is not valid knowledge.üîΩThe visual consciousness that

original: yul chos tha dad min nyid dang // tha dad nyid kyi dbyangs dang ni //
analyzed: yul chos tha dad min nyid dang // tha dad nyid kyi dbyangs dang ni //
translated: The object is not different, and is not non-different.üîΩThe sound is not heard, and is not not heard.

original: thos pa'i pha rol son dang gang //
analyzed: thos pa'i pha rol son dang gang //
translated: One who has attained the other shore of hearing,

original: de la shin tu mkhas thob 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la shin tu mkhas thob 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: will attain skill in that.

original: yang rab rib 'joms pa'i sbyor ba zhes kyang thos pa zhes gang smras pa de yang ma @6b yin te ;
analyzed: yang rab rib 'joms pa'i sbyor ba zhes kyang thos pa zhes gang smras pa de yang ma @6b yin te ;
translated: Also, it is not the case that the application that conquers cataracts is called ‚Äúhearing,‚Äù

original: da ltar rab rib med pa'i sgo nas yon tan thob par smra ba ni gzhan du yon tan thob par smras pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: da ltar rab rib med pa'i sgo nas yon tan thob par smra ba ni gzhan du yon tan thob par smras pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is said that the quality is attained through the absence of cataracts, and it is said that the quality is attained elsewhere.

original: 'di ltar yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: byi la dang / rnga mo dang / spyang ki la sogs pa'i mig skams pa'i phye mas mig bskus na mtshan mo yang nyin mo bzhin du mthong la /
analyzed: byi la dang / rnga mo dang / spyang ki la sogs pa'i mig skams pa'i phye mas mig bskus na mtshan mo yang nyin mo bzhin du mthong la /
translated: if the eyes of a cat, camel, jackal, and so on are smeared with the ashes of burnt chaff, they see at night as if it were day.

original: 'di la yang skyon bsal bas med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang skyon bsal bas med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in this case, the fault is not removed.

original: yang slu bar dogs pas gzhan la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / mi slu ba nyid du rtogs pas nges pa yin no zhes gang smras pa yang /
analyzed: yang slu bar dogs pas gzhan la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / mi slu ba nyid du rtogs pas nges pa yin no zhes gang smras pa yang /
translated: Also, it is not the case that it is dependent on another because of the fear of deception, and it is ascertained because of the understanding of nondeception.

original: de la mi slu ba don du gnyer ba yang tshad ma nyid tshol ba la brtson pa yin no zhes 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mi slu ba don du gnyer ba yang tshad ma nyid tshol ba la brtson pa yin no zhes 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: tshad ma ni bcom ldan 'das phan par bzhed pa nyid ston pa po nyid kyi ngo bo'i rgyu tshogs pa nyid kyis bde bar gshegs pa nyid la sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma ni bcom ldan 'das phan par bzhed pa nyid ston pa po nyid kyi ngo bo'i rgyu tshogs pa nyid kyis bde bar gshegs pa nyid la sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: Valid cognition is the very nature of the Blessed One, who is desirous of benefiting, and is the cause of the assembly itself, because it connects to the state of a sugata.

original: de nyid kyis na rgyu mi dmigs par ma grub pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rgyu mi dmigs par ma grub pa //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of the cause is not established.

original: skyob pa yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi dmigs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: skyob pa yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi dmigs pa yang ngo //
translated: And the non-apprehension of the effect is also because of being a protector.

original: de ltar ci las shes she na /
analyzed: de ltar ci las shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: tshad ma grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says the establishment of valid cognition, and so on.

original: 'dir rgyu ni rtog ge ngan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu ni rtog ge ngan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the cause is called bad reasoning.

original: bstan pa las phyin ci log pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa las phyin ci log pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is implicitly taught that what is contrary to the teaching is not valid cognition.

original: gang yang dang po'i phyed kyis bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: gang yang dang po'i phyed kyis bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: And whatever is the first half, having paid homage to the Blessed One,

original: gzhan gyi nyan pa po bstan bcos la 'jug pa'i don du brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa la sogs pa rgyu dang bcas par bstan pa'am kun gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyan pa po bstan bcos la 'jug pa'i don du brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa la sogs pa rgyu dang bcas par bstan pa'am kun gyis kyang ngo //
translated: The purpose of the treatise is to cause others to listen in order to enter the treatise.

original: de la brjod par bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma 'jig rten pha rol pa don dam par rtogs pa'i rgyur bcom ldan 'das nyid 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma nyid yongs su rtogs pa ni 'bras bu dman pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma 'jig rten pha rol pa don dam par rtogs pa'i rgyur bcom ldan 'das nyid 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma nyid yongs su rtogs pa ni 'bras bu dman pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The subject matter is valid knowledge that has the characteristics to be explained, which is the cause for realizing the world beyond and the ultimate. The complete understanding of the valid knowledge of the world is a lesser result.

original: de yang chos dang chos ma yin pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo dgos pa ni shugs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang chos dang chos ma yin pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo dgos pa ni shugs kyis bstan to //
translated: The purpose is also indirectly taught for the sake of understanding virtue and nonvirtue.

original: yang na tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la nye bar sbyor ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la nye bar sbyor ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the application to the perfection of the TathƒÅgata, which is the cause of valid knowledge.

original: 'grub par 'gyur ba ni 'gro ba'i don sgrub par byed pa can zhes bya bas de tshad ma'i sgrub pa'i sgo nas de nyid grub pa'i phyir tshad ma grub pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ba ni 'gro ba'i don sgrub par byed pa can zhes bya bas de tshad ma'i sgrub pa'i sgo nas de nyid grub pa'i phyir tshad ma grub pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is established‚Äù means that it is established as the means of accomplishing the aims of beings. Therefore, in order to establish reality by means of the establishment of valid cognition, the establishment of valid cognition is to be explained.

original: yang na 'dis sgrub par byed pa ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad ma yin no zhes rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dis sgrub par byed pa ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad ma yin no zhes rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the establishment of the Blessed Buddhas as valid because they are the means of establishing that.

original: de rtogs pa'i thabs phun sum tshogs pa grub pa yang tshad ma'i @7a * //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i thabs phun sum tshogs pa grub pa yang tshad ma'i @7a * //
translated: The establishment of the means of realizing that is the establishment of valid cognition.

original: grub pa'o // ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis nyan pa po dang rtsom pa po'i bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / bstan bcos kyi dgos pa dag gi thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'o // ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis nyan pa po dang rtsom pa po'i bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / bstan bcos kyi dgos pa dag gi thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the means of establishing reality as it is‚Äù indicates the relation between the result of the activity of the listener and the author, and the purpose of the treatise, in terms of the means and the result of the means.

original: gtso bo smos pa'i shugs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: gtso bo smos pa'i shugs kyis bstan to //
translated: It is indicated by the force of mentioning the principal matter.

original: gzhan du don med pa'am mi nus pa'am 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo don med par dogs pa la ni 'ga' yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba des nas /
analyzed: gzhan du don med pa'am mi nus pa'am 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo don med par dogs pa la ni 'ga' yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba des nas /
translated: Otherwise, if one suspects that the meaning is useless, or that it is impossible, or that it is not worth wanting, then no one would engage in it.

original: bstan bcos byed pa rnams rang nyid ngag dang po la rab tu sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa rnams rang nyid ngag dang po la rab tu sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the authors of treatises apply themselves to the first statement.

original: gzhan la phan par zhugs pa de rnams log par brjod pa la ni dgos pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par zhugs pa de rnams log par brjod pa la ni dgos pa med do //
translated: For those who are engaged in benefiting others, there is no purpose in false speech.

original: des na yang ngag gi don la the tshom du 'gyur la des ni don du gnyer ba rnams 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na yang ngag gi don la the tshom du 'gyur la des ni don du gnyer ba rnams 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there would be doubt about the meaning of the statement, and that would cause those who seek the meaning to engage in it.

original: don la the tshom za ba yang nges pa can bzhin du zhing gi las la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kha cig gis 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: don la the tshom za ba yang nges pa can bzhin du zhing gi las la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kha cig gis 'dod pa'o //
translated: And because it is seen that even those who doubt the meaning engage in activities such as farming as if they were certain, this is the assertion of some.

original: bstan bcos byed pa log par smra ba ma yin par ci las shes she na /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa log par smra ba ma yin par ci las shes she na /
translated: How is it known that the author of the treatise is not a false teacher?

original: smras pa / gzhan bslu ba'i ched du log par byed pa ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams ni rang nyid slu bar mi byed pas gzhan bslu bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos kyi dang por log par brjod pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan bslu ba'i ched du log par byed pa ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams ni rang nyid slu bar mi byed pas gzhan bslu bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos kyi dang por log par brjod pa ni mi srid do //
translated: Objection: One who acts falsely for the purpose of deceiving others does not deceive himself. Therefore, it is impossible that the treatise was composed to deceive others by stating falsehoods at the outset.

original: mkhas pa nyid du rab tu gnas pa'i ched du dang po nyid nas brtsams nas log par smra ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa la rab tu gnas pa 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan slu bar byed par 'dod pa las rang nyid bslus pa kho nar 'gyur bar
analyzed: mkhas pa nyid du rab tu gnas pa'i ched du dang po nyid nas brtsams nas log par smra ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa la rab tu gnas pa 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan slu bar byed par 'dod pa las rang nyid bslus pa kho nar 'gyur bar
translated: One who speaks falsely at the outset for the purpose of establishing himself as a scholar would be destroyed by his own desire to establish himself. Therefore, one who desires to deceive others would only deceive himself.

original: rig pa'i phyir log par brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i phyir log par brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that he speaks falsely because he is aware of this.

original: de ltar na yang phyin ci log par don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang phyin ci log par don med pa ma yin te /
translated: Even so, it is not that he has no purpose in speaking falsely.

original: rigs pas nges bzhin pa'i don nyid ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar don la the tshom du 'gyur ba med pa ni med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas nges bzhin pa'i don nyid ni nges pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar don la the tshom du 'gyur ba med pa ni med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the meaning is ascertained by reasoning, it is ascertained. Since the meaning is not nonexistent, how could it be doubted?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: lam 'di na srog chags gdugs pa la sogs pa don med par 'gyur ba med par nges na gser la sogs pa'i don yod par nges par 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: lam 'di na srog chags gdugs pa la sogs pa don med par 'gyur ba med par nges na gser la sogs pa'i don yod par nges par 'gyur ram ci /
translated: If it is certain that there are no harmful animals on this road, then is it certain that there is gold?

original: srog chags gdug pa la sogs pa med ba dang gser la sogs pa ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags gdug pa la sogs pa med ba dang gser la sogs pa ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the absence of harmful animals and the presence of gold are different.

original: 'di la yang bya rog gi so la sogs pa'i bstan bcos gzhan du brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa med pa ma yin par nges na don med pa nyid kyang nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yang bya rog gi so la sogs pa'i bstan bcos gzhan du brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa med pa ma yin par nges na don med pa nyid kyang nges par 'gyur te /
translated: And here, if it is certain that there is no purpose in the treatise on crow‚Äôs teeth, then it is certain that it is pointless.

original: de ma yin pa ni de nyid yin pa'i @7b phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ma yin pa ni de nyid yin pa'i @7b phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not that.

original: / brjod par bya ba la sogs pa'i yul tshig las rnam par shes pa nges pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan las byung ba'i nges pa yang phyogs can yin pa sel bar mi byed pa'i brjod par bya ba la sogs pa nyid ni yod dam med par the tshom
analyzed: / brjod par bya ba la sogs pa'i yul tshig las rnam par shes pa nges pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan las byung ba'i nges pa yang phyogs can yin pa sel bar mi byed pa'i brjod par bya ba la sogs pa nyid ni yod dam med par the tshom
translated: Also, the ascertainment that arises from the reason of the absence of a definite consciousness of the object of expression and so on is also a partial object, because one doubts whether the object of expression and so on exists or does not exist,

original: za ba yin gyi /
analyzed: za ba yin gyi /
translated: since it is not the exclusion of non-that.

original: phyin ci log pa yang ma yin la de nyid du nges par yang mi byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa yang ma yin la de nyid du nges par yang mi byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that it is not mistaken, and that it does not make one ascertain the real?

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir de nyid don med pa ma yin par rigs pas nges de'i ngo bo'i don du nges pa'i phyir don med pa la the tshom za ba med par nges pa ni don med pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir de nyid don med pa ma yin par rigs pas nges de'i ngo bo'i don du nges pa'i phyir don med pa la the tshom za ba med par nges pa ni don med pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable that it is not ascertained, because it is ascertained as the meaning of that nature. Therefore, it is not the case that there is no ascertainment of the meaning that is not ascertained.

original: de de ltar na yang don med pa la the tshom za ba med pa nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar na yang don med pa la the tshom za ba med pa nges pa yin te /
translated: Even if it is like that, there is no ascertainment of the meaning that is not ascertained.

original: yod kyang rung med kyang rung yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod kyang rung med kyang rung yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Whether it exists or not, it exists.

original: tshig tsam gyi rig pa la ni mkhas na don med par nges pa yang ldog pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyi rig pa la ni mkhas na don med par nges pa yang ldog pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: If one is skilled in mere verbal knowledge, then even the ascertainment of the meaning that is not ascertained is not the object of reversal.

original: don med pa la med par nges pa yang don la nges pa nyid ces bya bar rigs pas nges pa nyid de the tshom med par don la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: don med pa la med par nges pa yang don la nges pa nyid ces bya bar rigs pas nges pa nyid de the tshom med par don la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of the meaning that is not ascertained is also the ascertainment of the meaning that is ascertained. Therefore, it is reasonable to engage in the meaning without doubt.üîΩIf it is said that the treatise is twofold, namely the word and the meaning,

original: bstan bcos ni rnam pa gnyis te sgra dang don to zhe na yang smras pa la /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni rnam pa gnyis te sgra dang don to zhe na yang smras pa la /
translated: then it is said:

original: sgra'i cha ni rang gi don rtogs par byed pa yin gyi dgos pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: sgra'i cha ni rang gi don rtogs par byed pa yin gyi dgos pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: The function of the word is to cause the understanding of its own meaning, and it has no other purpose.

original: don ni don med par yang snang ba'i phyir de'i dgos pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don ni don med par yang snang ba'i phyir de'i dgos pa bstan pa ni /
translated: But since the meaning is also perceived when the word is not present, the purpose of the word is taught:

original: sgra yod na 'byung ba ma yin te bstan bcos rdzogs pa la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra yod na 'byung ba ma yin te bstan bcos rdzogs pa la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word does not occur when the word is present, because it is not seen at the end of the treatise, and because it occurs when the object of expression is present.

original: des na yang brjod par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na yang brjod par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the object of expression is not the purpose of the word.

original: de ni ma yin te sgra'i cha'i bya ba ni rang gi don rtogs par byed pa kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te sgra'i cha'i bya ba ni rang gi don rtogs par byed pa kho na ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because the function of the word is not just to cause the understanding of its own meaning,

original: mngon par 'dod pa kho na la gtod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa kho na la gtod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directed only to what is desired.

original: mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyang rtog par byed par 'dod pa'i tshig rang gi don bzhin du byed pa ma yin gyi gang la gtod pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyang rtog par byed par 'dod pa'i tshig rang gi don bzhin du byed pa ma yin gyi gang la gtod pa'i sgra'o //
translated: And what is desired is not the word that is desired to be understood, but the meaning that is directed by the word.

original: de nyid ni sgra'i don gyi gtso bo yin gyi rang gi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni sgra'i don gyi gtso bo yin gyi rang gi don ni ma yin te /
translated: That is the primary meaning of the word, not its own meaning,

original: de la mi gtod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi gtod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not directed to that.

original: bud shing gi 'bar ba tsam ni bya ba rdzogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bud shing gi 'bar ba tsam ni bya ba rdzogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere blazing of fuel is not the completion of the action.

original: de nyid kyi rim gyis 'tshed pa nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir tshig nyid kyi dgos pa ni de yin gyi kun las btus pa bshad pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rim gyis 'tshed pa nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir tshig nyid kyi dgos pa ni de yin gyi kun las btus pa bshad pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it is the purpose of cooking itself that it engages in cooking by that process, it is not for the purpose of explaining the Compendium of Epistemology,

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa la don gzhan gyi bya ba med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa la don gzhan gyi bya ba med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other object of action for correct knowledge.

original: de lta yin na 'grel par dang po'i tshig smos par ji ltar yin 'chad par 'gyur @8a * //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'grel par dang po'i tshig smos par ji ltar yin 'chad par 'gyur @8a * //
translated: If that is so, how is it that the Autocommentary states that the first word is mentioned?

original: ba'i bstan bcos ma lus pa'i don du dam bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: ba'i bstan bcos ma lus pa'i don du dam bcas pa yin la /
translated: The treatise to be explained is committed to the meaning of the entire treatise.

original: de rnams kyang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang 'dra bar tshad ma yin te /
translated: And because they are inferences for the purpose of others, they are valid cognitions, like ‚ÄúSound is impermanent‚Äù and so on,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul bstan par dam bcas pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa de lta na ci'i phyir dgag / smras pa /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul bstan par dam bcas pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa de lta na ci'i phyir dgag / smras pa /
translated: because the object of the inference is committed to. If it is an inference because it is an inference, why is it refuted?

original: khyab par byed pa'i gtan tshigs la mi dgos pa'i phyir zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i gtan tshigs la mi dgos pa'i phyir zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because it is not necessary for a pervading reason.

original: de nyid kyi rgyun phyi ma rnams kyang sgrub par byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyun phyi ma rnams kyang sgrub par byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in order to demonstrate that the subsequent continuations of that very [reason] are also established,

original: yang dang yang du shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: yang dang yang du shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: it is sufficient to elaborate again and again.

original: khyab par byed pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because the pervader is without purpose, the reason will be explained.

original: da ni rang nyid la log par sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir smra ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni rang nyid la log par sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir smra ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to remove one's own misconceptions, he says the speaker, and so on.

original: de la sgro 'dogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sgro 'dogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There, misconception is of two kinds:

original: da ltar ba dang 'das pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba dang 'das pa'o //
translated: present and past.

original: re zhig da ltar ba bzhin du gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa dang 'grel bshad de /
analyzed: re zhig da ltar ba bzhin du gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa dang 'grel bshad de /
translated: First, like the present, there is the commentary that clarifies, and the subcommentary.

original: khyed kyi don de 'grel pa med pas de yang gzhag go //
analyzed: khyed kyi don de 'grel pa med pas de yang gzhag go //
translated: Since your meaning is without commentary, that too is set aside.

original: 'on kyang gzhan cung zad nyid rang gi shes rab kyi nyams bzhin du bi la si ta brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan cung zad nyid rang gi shes rab kyi nyams bzhin du bi la si ta brjod par bya ste /
translated: However, just a little bit more, like the experience of one's own wisdom, should be expressed.

original: de la su zhig rtsi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de la su zhig rtsi bar 'gyur //
translated: Who would believe that?

original: rnal ma'i lam ni dor nas ni //
analyzed: rnal ma'i lam ni dor nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the path of simplicity,

original: su zhig gol ba'i lam 'gror rigs //
analyzed: su zhig gol ba'i lam 'gror rigs //
translated: who would be fit to go on the wrong path?

original: zhes 'brel pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'gro ba sgro 'dogs shing grags pa ma yin pas nyan pa po sems 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: zhes 'brel pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'gro ba sgro 'dogs shing grags pa ma yin pas nyan pa po sems 'joms par byed do //
translated: Thus, the one who is attached to the relation, who is full of false imagination, who is not famous, destroys the mind of the listener.

original: de bsal ba yang 'grel pa la sogs pa'i skyon bstan pa ma yin na mi 'byung pa'i phyir rigs pa dang 'jig rten dang 'gal ba smra bar bya ba'i tshig ma yin pa gzhan rjod par byed pa don chen po la don med par nges par sbyor ba
analyzed: de bsal ba yang 'grel pa la sogs pa'i skyon bstan pa ma yin na mi 'byung pa'i phyir rigs pa dang 'jig rten dang 'gal ba smra bar bya ba'i tshig ma yin pa gzhan rjod par byed pa don chen po la don med par nges par sbyor ba
translated: And the removal of that is not the teaching of the faults of the commentary, etc., because it does not occur. Therefore, the one who speaks of what is contradictory to reasoning and the world, who speaks words that are not to be spoken, who is certainly engaged in the meaningless with regard to the great meaning,

original: la sogs pa de'i skyon rnams bstan pa ni phyed snga mas so //
analyzed: la sogs pa de'i skyon rnams bstan pa ni phyed snga mas so //
translated: The teaching of those faults, etc., is by the first half.

original: gzhan dag gis ni de las bzlog pas rang gi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni de las bzlog pas rang gi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: Others, by the opposite of that, teach their own system.

original: brtsams pa'i dngos po rgyun du byed pa rnams phal che bas mi mthong zhes bya ba ni smra bar bya ba'i tshig ma yin pa smra ba'i smra ba po rnams kyis chen po'o //
analyzed: brtsams pa'i dngos po rgyun du byed pa rnams phal che bas mi mthong zhes bya ba ni smra bar bya ba'i tshig ma yin pa smra ba'i smra ba po rnams kyis chen po'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúMost people do not see the things that are being composed‚Äù is the greatest of all statements made by those who speak without knowing what they should say.

original: mi gsal bar rjod par byed pas skyon dang ldan pa nyid sbas pa ni lhad can gyi dngul dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: mi gsal bar rjod par byed pas skyon dang ldan pa nyid sbas pa ni lhad can gyi dngul dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: The fault of obscurity is like the fault of adulteration.

original: de rnams kyang phal cher 'grel bshad pa la yod pa ni rigs pa dang 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang phal cher 'grel bshad pa la yod pa ni rigs pa dang 'grel pa'o //
translated: Most of these faults are found in commentaries and treatises.

original: de ltar 'di dag nyid kyis smra @8b bar bya ba'i tshig ma yin pa ni gnas skabs ma yin pa ni rgyun las phyi rol du gyur pa dang / ma yin pa la sogs pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i tshul gyis bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rig pas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag nyid kyis smra @8b bar bya ba'i tshig ma yin pa ni gnas skabs ma yin pa ni rgyun las phyi rol du gyur pa dang / ma yin pa la sogs pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i tshul gyis bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rig pas rtogs pa yin no //
