original: bdag nyid dang mtshungs par ser po la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa yin gyi mi dmigs pa'am gzhan yang rung ba la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang mtshungs par ser po la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa yin gyi mi dmigs pa'am gzhan yang rung ba la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: It is the exclusion of yellow, etc., which is the same as the self, and it is not dependent on non-apprehension or something else.

original: dmigs byar gyur pa ma yin pa'i ser po yod pa yang mi dmigs pa la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: dmigs byar gyur pa ma yin pa'i ser po yod pa yang mi dmigs pa la ltos pa yin la /
translated: The existence of yellow, etc., which is not the object of apprehension, is dependent on non-apprehension.

original: gzhan ni bde ba ni yod kyang mi snang la /
analyzed: gzhan ni bde ba ni yod kyang mi snang la /
translated: The other, i.e., pleasure, exists but is not manifest.

original: de gzhan la me snang ba de bzhin du ser po yang ngo //
analyzed: de gzhan la me snang ba de bzhin du ser po yang ngo //
translated: Just as that is manifest to another, so is yellow.üîΩYellow, etc., which is not manifest to oneself or to another, is just like pleasure, etc.

original: ser po la sogs pa rang dang gzhan la yang snang ba ma yin pa ni bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dra ba kho na snang ba la yang khyad par du gzhan la snang ba ni ser po la ltos pa yin la bde ba yang mtshungs pa yin
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa rang dang gzhan la yang snang ba ma yin pa ni bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dra ba kho na snang ba la yang khyad par du gzhan la snang ba ni ser po la ltos pa yin la bde ba yang mtshungs pa yin
translated: The difference is that the manifestation of the other is dependent on yellow, and pleasure is the same.

original: no // de ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba yod ba de'i rgyud la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyid mi myong ba'i phyir med pa yin no //
analyzed: no // de ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba yod ba de'i rgyud la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyid mi myong ba'i phyir med pa yin no //
translated: Just as pleasure exists in that continuum, so pain does not exist there because it is not experienced.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa la ni the tshom za'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa la ni the tshom za'o //
translated: One doubts that it exists in another continuum.

original: de bzhin du sngon po la yang ser po rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo log pas med de //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po la yang ser po rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo log pas med de //
translated: Likewise, blue does not exist by the cessation of the nature of the essence of the cognition of yellow.

original: rgyud gzhan la yod pa la yang the tshom za'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la yod pa la yang the tshom za'o //
translated: And one doubts whether it exists in another continuum.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa bdag med pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir bye brag med pa la yang bye brag tu brtag par bya ba mngon sum gyis grub pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa bdag med pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir bye brag med pa la yang bye brag tu brtag par bya ba mngon sum gyis grub pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Therefore, since pleasure, etc. and blue, etc. are established by direct perception as selfless, the word ‚Äúestablished‚Äù is used in the expression ‚Äúestablished by direct perception‚Äù in order to indicate that the investigation of the difference in the absence of difference is to be done without distinction.

original: mngon sum gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir 'jig rten ma yin pa'i don du bshad do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir 'jig rten ma yin pa'i don du bshad do //
translated: And it is explained that the meaning of ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is not worldly.

original: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa can ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha snyad bzhin du dgag pa de'i ngo bo la mi dmigs pa tsam las med do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad tsam bsgrub pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du lkog shal la sogs pa can ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha snyad bzhin du dgag pa de'i ngo bo la mi dmigs pa tsam las med do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad tsam bsgrub pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Likewise, the mere expression ‚Äúthere is no more than the mere non-apprehension of the nature of the negation‚Äù is taught in order to establish the mere expression ‚Äúthere is no more than the mere non-apprehension of the nature of the negation,‚Äù just as the expression ‚Äúan ox is one that has a dewlap, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na lkog shal la sogs pa las ba lang du gtogs pa bzhin no zhes rnam 'grel las bstan to //
analyzed: dper na lkog shal la sogs pa las ba lang du gtogs pa bzhin no zhes rnam 'grel las bstan to //
translated: The Exposition of Validating Cognition teaches that it is like the inclusion of an ox in the category of that which has a dewlap, etc.

original: de la mi dmigs pas khyad par du med pa'i tha snyad du bya bar rtogs pa ni dman pa'i rang 'dod yin no //
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pas khyad par du med pa'i tha snyad du bya bar rtogs pa ni dman pa'i rang 'dod yin no //
translated: The inferior person, on the other hand, is one who, not perceiving the distinction, thinks that the word is used without distinction.

original: chen po'i tshig kyang 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: chen po'i tshig kyang 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúgreat‚Äù is not contrary to the world.

original: de 'di la med pa'i phyir 'jig rten dang 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'di la med pa'i phyir 'jig rten dang 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not contrary to the world because it is not found in the world.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa de bzhin du sgrub pa ni gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa de bzhin du sgrub pa ni gnas skabs so //
translated: The proof of the statement is in the context.

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa can thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi don rgyas @9a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa can thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi don rgyas @9a * //
translated: The meaning of the reason for the omniscience of the one who has momentariness, etc.

original: pa ni khyab pa la sogs pa bstan pa la the tshom med pa yin na de ni de dag gis ma byas so //
analyzed: pa ni khyab pa la sogs pa bstan pa la the tshom med pa yin na de ni de dag gis ma byas so //
translated: is the non-doubt about the teaching of pervasion, etc. But that is not done by them.

original: rim dang cig car dag gi byed pa po nyid lan cig mthong ba de'i rgyu mtshan nyid khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag gi byed pa po nyid lan cig mthong ba de'i rgyu mtshan nyid khyab pa yin la /
translated: The reason for the one who is the agent of the sequential and the simultaneous is the pervasion.

original: rtag pa la yang rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa la yang rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: But for the permanent, sequence and non-sequence are contradictory, and so impermanence is established.

original: bden te de log pas ldog pa'i byed pa po nyid la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te de log pas ldog pa'i byed pa po nyid la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin gyi /
translated: True, but the agent of the cessation of that is pervaded by impermanence,

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis kyang ma yin la /
translated: but not by momentariness.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig ma ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig ma ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence is not momentary,

original: zla ba dang lo la sogs pa yang mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba dang lo la sogs pa yang mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the moon, the year, etc. are impermanent.

original: de ltar gnas pa ni rtag pa bzhin du rim dang rim pa ma yin pa 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa ni rtag pa bzhin du rim dang rim pa ma yin pa 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, endurance, like permanence, is not incompatible with order and disorder,

original: lhan cig tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen simultaneously.

original: de ltar mthong ba ma yin pa gzhan du yang mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba ma yin pa gzhan du yang mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not seen in that way, it is not seen elsewhere.

original: srog chags la sogs pa bzhin du byed pa po bdag nyid kyang skad cig ma nyid yin pas rjes su 'gro ba ma yin zhing ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa ni skabs kyi don rgyas par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srog chags la sogs pa bzhin du byed pa po bdag nyid kyang skad cig ma nyid yin pas rjes su 'gro ba ma yin zhing ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa ni skabs kyi don rgyas par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the self, like a living being, etc., is momentary, it is not concomitant with or incompatible with the agent. The author of the commentary does not elaborate on the meaning of the context.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par mi gnas pa tha ma'i skad cig ma la dang po'i skad cig ma ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par mi gnas pa tha ma'i skad cig ma la dang po'i skad cig ma ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: In the second moment and so on, it does not endure, and in the final moment, it is dependent on the first moment.

original: phyi ma ni ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid ji ltar mi rtag pa yin /
analyzed: phyi ma ni ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid ji ltar mi rtag pa yin /
translated: But since the latter is not the former, how can momentariness be impermanence?

original: rim dang cig car bdag nyid kyis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel gyi dgongs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rim dang cig car bdag nyid kyis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel gyi dgongs pa yang yin no //
translated: The purport of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika is that it is contradictory for something to be essentially both gradual and instantaneous.

original: snang du mi rung ba brtag par dam 'cha' ba'am snang ba la yang rung ba'i dngos po la zhes skabs ji lta bar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang du mi rung ba brtag par dam 'cha' ba'am snang ba la yang rung ba'i dngos po la zhes skabs ji lta bar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained below that it is not tenable to posit that which is not suitable to appear as an object of knowledge, or that which is suitable to appear as an object of knowledge.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: dam pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i mngon sum mo //üîΩde'i bya ba'i yul ji snyed pa'i tha snyad pa dang cig shos te /
analyzed: dam pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i mngon sum mo // de'i bya ba'i yul ji snyed pa'i tha snyad pa dang cig shos te /
translated: The ultimate is the nonerroneous nature of things, which is the object of reflexive awareness.üîΩThe conventional is the object of the activity of that, and it is the object of the activity of that.

original: don de des bsdus pa ste bstan bcos kyi don thams cad de'i mthar thug pa nyid du rigs pas grub pa'o //
analyzed: don de des bsdus pa ste bstan bcos kyi don thams cad de'i mthar thug pa nyid du rigs pas grub pa'o //
translated: The entire meaning of the treatise is established by reasoning to be included within that.

original: dam pa'i don la 'dus par yang rung ste nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i don la 'dus par yang rung ste nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is also suitable to be included in the ultimate, and so it is a summary.

original: brgyud pas sam dngos su yang rung ste /
analyzed: brgyud pas sam dngos su yang rung ste /
translated: It is either indirect or direct,

original: bstan bcos ma lhas pa de'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos ma lhas pa de'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the meaning of the treatise.

original: de la blo ni re re'i rnam par 'grel par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de la blo ni re re'i rnam par 'grel par ston pa yin no //
translated: The intellect is taught to be the commentary on each of those.

original: de rnams la ni de med de /
analyzed: de rnams la ni de med de /
translated: They do not have that,

original: brgyud de 'ongs pa mi shes pas rig pa la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyud de 'ongs pa mi shes pas rig pa la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not know what comes indirectly, and because they do not appear to awareness.

original: don med pa ni snying po med pa'i rim pa ste spangs pa ni @9b bor ba'o //
analyzed: don med pa ni snying po med pa'i rim pa ste spangs pa ni @9b bor ba'o //
translated: Meaningless is the stage of no essence. Abandoning is throwing away.

original: chen po'i don la phyin ci log tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: chen po'i don la phyin ci log tu ston pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the meaning of great.

original: de rnams gang yin pa la ni de med pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de rnams gang yin pa la ni de med pa dang 'brel to //
translated: It is related to those that do not have that.

original: 'dis kyang skra las byung ba yang bsal ba ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rna ba la sogs pa'i shes ba la /
analyzed: 'dis kyang skra las byung ba yang bsal ba ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rna ba la sogs pa'i shes ba la /
translated: This also teaches that the arising from hair is eliminated.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa ni mi slu ba ma yin pa'i phyir ma khyab pa'i skyon sel bar byed pa'i smra ba po rnams kyi bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don mthun pa nyid du nges par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa ni mi slu ba ma yin pa'i phyir ma khyab pa'i skyon sel bar byed pa'i smra ba po rnams kyi bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don mthun pa nyid du nges par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Since a consciousness of a different type is not non-deceptive, the fault of over-pervasion is removed. The meaning of the words of the one who speaks is definitely applied in a similar way.

original: rang las rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba 'di'i yang shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho na rang las rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang las rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba 'di'i yang shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho na rang las rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúfrom itself, its own nature,‚Äù the consciousness itself realizes its own nature.

original: tshad ma nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir skabs kyis gzhan las tshad ma nyid bsgrub par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir skabs kyis gzhan las tshad ma nyid bsgrub par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Since it is not valid cognition, the context is that it is asserted that valid cognition is established from another.

original: de las bzlog pa rang las tshad ma nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rang las tshad ma nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is explained in order to show that valid cognition is established from itself.

original: gyur ba smos pa ni ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan bcos kyi brjod par bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das yin par bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs brjod par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: gyur ba smos pa ni ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan bcos kyi brjod par bya ba'i bcom ldan 'das yin par bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs brjod par 'dod pa la /
translated: The word ‚Äúindeed‚Äù is stated in order to show that the treatise is to be composed in order to prove that the Blessed One is the object of the treatise, as stated in the lines ‚ÄúThe one who is not . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: skabs ma yin bzhin du tshigs bcad kyi gyur pa sgra bshad par 'dod pa nyid la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa chen po'i don la don med par zhugs nas smra ba yin na rang gi gzhung du ni ji skad smras pa'i skyon medüîΩpar des na zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs ma yin bzhin du tshigs bcad kyi gyur pa sgra bshad par 'dod pa nyid la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa chen po'i don la don med par zhugs nas smra ba yin na rang gi gzhung du ni ji skad smras pa'i skyon med par des na zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If one engages in speaking without meaning in the great meaning, then in one's own text, one teaches as shown by the word therefore, without the fault stated.

original: ro nyams zhes bya ba ni ji skad smras ba'i skyon ma lus pa med par mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ro nyams zhes bya ba ni ji skad smras ba'i skyon ma lus pa med par mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word taste indicates that one is free from all the faults stated.

original: shin du zhes bya ba yang rim pa gzhan la gus pa ni 'bras bu phul du byung ba yin na //
analyzed: shin du zhes bya ba yang rim pa gzhan la gus pa ni 'bras bu phul du byung ba yin na //
translated: The word very indicates that respect for another stage is the supreme fruit.

original: skal bar ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la dbang byed pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: skal bar ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la dbang byed pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word fortunate and so on are words that control that.

original: skal ba dang ldan pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis bskyed pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis bskyed pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Fortunate means the perfection of wisdom that is produced by nature.

original: mthong gyur ces bya ba ni mngon par sbyangs pa las byung ba can yin pa'am /
analyzed: mthong gyur ces bya ba ni mngon par sbyangs pa las byung ba can yin pa'am /
translated: The word seen means that it arises from manifest effort.

original: skal ba dang ldan pa nyid ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa nyid ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
translated: The excellence of good fortune is the excellence of the spiritual gene.

original: mthong gyur blo nyid ni ngo bo nyid can nam sbyangs pa can gyi shes rab phul du byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthong gyur blo nyid ni ngo bo nyid can nam sbyangs pa can gyi shes rab phul du byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The excellence of the mind that has seen the truth is to be connected with the excellence of the wisdom that is innate or that comes from purification.

original: yang na snga mas ni rigs phul du byung ba /
analyzed: yang na snga mas ni rigs phul du byung ba /
translated: Or else, the former is the excellence of the spiritual gene,

original: phyi mas ni sbyor ba phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi mas ni sbyor ba phul du byung ba'o //
translated: and the latter is the excellence of application.

original: grogs phun sum tshogs pa dang rigs phun sum tshogs pa yang rung /
analyzed: grogs phun sum tshogs pa dang rigs phun sum tshogs pa yang rung /
translated: The excellence of the spiritual friend and the excellence of the spiritual gene,

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa yang rung bar go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa yang rung bar go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and the excellence of aspiration and the excellence of application, should be connected respectively.

original: 'dir ni de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid kyi bye brag 'dod pa 'am @10a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid kyi bye brag 'dod pa 'am @10a * //
translated: Here, the excellence of the spiritual gene is the excellence of the cause, and the excellence of the spiritual friend is the excellence of the condition.

original: smras pa'i skyon rnams dor bar bya ba'i ched kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa'i skyon rnams dor bar bya ba'i ched kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The excellence of aspiration is the excellence of application, and the excellence of the mind that has seen the truth is the excellence of result.

original: shin tu dag pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'i blo thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ste
analyzed: shin tu dag pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'i blo thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ste
translated: The extremely pure is the wisdom of the Tathagata, the essence of the realization of the nondual omniscient exalted wisdom that is stainless because it abandons all afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience together with their imprints.

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa rigs pa sems pa'i rang bzhin can gyi blos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa rigs pa sems pa'i rang bzhin can gyi blos so //
translated: It is established by the nature of the reasoning mind that is the nature of the result.

original: yang dag pa ste sngar smras pa'i skyon yongs su spangs pas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ste sngar smras pa'i skyon yongs su spangs pas so //
translated: It is correct because it is completely free of the faults mentioned earlier.

original: rab tu rnam 'byed kyi khyad par can du bshad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rnam 'byed kyi khyad par can du bshad par byed pa'o //
translated: It is explained as having the distinction of perfect discernment.

original: khyad par can gyi don yin pa'i phyir yon tan ma lus pa yongs su bsdus pa bstan pa yin gyi 'grel pa la sogs pa'i bstan pa tsam sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin pas de ni ci yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi don yin pa'i phyir yon tan ma lus pa yongs su bsdus pa bstan pa yin gyi 'grel pa la sogs pa'i bstan pa tsam sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin pas de ni ci yang ma yin te /
translated: Because it has the meaning of distinction, it teaches the complete inclusion of all good qualities, but it does not establish mere statements such as commentaries, and so it is nothing at all.

original: phyis bya ba nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyis bya ba nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that later activities will not be impaired.

original: rnam 'grel mdzad pa skal ldan bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa shin tu zab mo gang yang rung ba la 'jug pa spong bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam 'grel mdzad pa skal ldan bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa shin tu zab mo gang yang rung ba la 'jug pa spong bar byed pa ni /
translated: The author of the Pramanavarttika saw that the disciples who possessed special wisdom were unable to grasp the very profound assertions of the fortunate Bhavyakirti, which were rejected by the opponents.

original: shes rab khyad par can dang ldan ba'i slob ma rnams kyis kyang 'dzin par mi nus par gzigs nas yid mi bde bas blo'i nus pa chung ba min pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdzad do zhes grag go //
analyzed: shes rab khyad par can dang ldan ba'i slob ma rnams kyis kyang 'dzin par mi nus par gzigs nas yid mi bde bas blo'i nus pa chung ba min pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdzad do zhes grag go //
translated: Therefore, he wrote the passage beginning with ‚Äúthose who are not of little mental power‚Äù and so on.üîΩThis is what is said.üîΩMoreover, since those who have not found anyone else superior to themselves still explain it, the meaning of the passage on the teaching of the rejection is as follows.

original: de yang da dung du yang bdag las lhag pa gzhan ma rnyed pa rnams la bshad par byed pas spong bar byed pa bstan pa'i skabs kyi don zhes bya ba la sogs pa yon tan dang ldan pa de rnams kyis ma mthong bas yid mi bde ba gang
analyzed: de yang da dung du yang bdag las lhag pa gzhan ma rnyed pa rnams la bshad par byed pas spong bar byed pa bstan pa'i skabs kyi don zhes bya ba la sogs pa yon tan dang ldan pa de rnams kyis ma mthong bas yid mi bde ba gang
translated: Since those who possess the qualities mentioned above do not see it, they are unhappy.

original: yin pa de ltar ni med do zhes dgag pa gnyis sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: yin pa de ltar ni med do zhes dgag pa gnyis sbyar ba yin no //
translated: This is not the case, as indicated by the two negations.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir rnam 'grel 'di la skyon thams cad spangs pa'i bshad par byed pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam 'grel 'di la skyon thams cad spangs pa'i bshad par byed pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Because this commentary on the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava has been composed in such a way as to eliminate all faults,

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i tshad ma yongs su gsal bas blo gros bzang po can rtogs par byed pa kho bos byas so zhes bya ba ni rgyu nye bar dgod pa'o //üîΩyang na rang nyid la'am yul la skyon yod pa srid pa mi 'jug pa'i yan lag skyon nye bar bstan bas rnam 'grel dang de'i bshad pa la yang go rims bzhin du tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis gsal
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i tshad ma yongs su gsal bas blo gros bzang po can rtogs par byed pa kho bos byas so zhes bya ba ni rgyu nye bar dgod pa'o // yang na rang nyid la'am yul la skyon yod pa srid pa mi 'jug pa'i yan lag skyon nye bar bstan bas rnam 'grel dang de'i bshad pa la yang go rims bzhin du tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis gsal
translated: it is a means of understanding for those with good minds, since it makes the unerring valid cognition completely clear. This is the statement of the reason.

original: bar rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa'i yan lag tu byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bar rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa'i yan lag tu byed pa yin no //
translated: Or, the two verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe valid cognition‚Äù and so forth, respectively, indicate the presence of faults in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava and its commentary, which are the limbs of non-engagement, and are composed as the limb of engagement for those who have the understanding that it is possible that there are faults in either the subject or oneself.

original: de dag las tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya bas ni yul te rnam 'grel la skyon @10b yod pa srid pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag las tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya bas ni yul te rnam 'grel la skyon @10b yod pa srid pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe valid cognition‚Äù indicates the subject, the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava, in which it is possible that there are faults.

original: rtog ge ngan pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid la'o //
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBad sophistry‚Äù indicates oneself.

original: de nyid kyis na de'i bshad pa'i yul la yang skyon yod pa srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de'i bshad pa'i yul la yang skyon yod pa srid pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible that there is a fault in the object explained by him,

original: rang nyid la yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang nyid la yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: and it is not possible that there is a fault in himself.

original: phal che ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phal che ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúfor the most part.‚ÄùüîΩMoreover, why did the author of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika not explain the Vedas, etc.,üîΩbut did explain the Buddha‚Äôs deeds?üîΩThis is because although the Vedas, etc., are not distinguished as false,üîΩit is not right to think that they are distinguished as true.

original: gzhan yang ci'i phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas rigs byed la sogs pa rnam par 'grel par ma mdzad kyi /üîΩsangs rgyas pa'i mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir log pa'i shes par bye brag med kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci'i phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas rigs byed la sogs pa rnam par 'grel par ma mdzad kyi / sangs rgyas pa'i mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir log pa'i shes par bye brag med kyang /

original: rigs byed la sogs pa gsal nas sangs rgyas pa'i lta bar phyogs gcig tu ltung bar mi rigs so snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rigs byed la sogs pa gsal nas sangs rgyas pa'i lta bar phyogs gcig tu ltung bar mi rigs so snyam du sems pa la /
translated: This is because it is not right to think that the Vedas, etc., are distinguished as true.üîΩThis is because it is not right to think that the Vedas, etc., are distinguished as true.üîΩThis is because it is not right to think that the Vedas, etc., are distinguished as true.üîΩThis is because it is not right to think that the Vedas, etc., are distinguished as true.üîΩThis is because it is not right to think that the Vedas, etc., are distinguished as true.

original: dam pa'i don la bslu ba dang mi slu bar byed pa sangs rgyas cig shos dag phyogs su ltung ba dang mi ltung ba bstan pa ni tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i don la bslu ba dang mi slu bar byed pa sangs rgyas cig shos dag phyogs su ltung ba dang mi ltung ba bstan pa ni tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is because it is not right to think that the Vedas, etc., are distinguished as true.üîΩThis is because

original: de nyid kyis ni yang de'i rnam 'grel mnyan pa dang bshad pa'i phyir bshad sbyar gyis nye bar bzung yang rigs kyi dpyod pa la sogs pa'i ni ma yin gyi bstan pa ni phan cher zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni yang de'i rnam 'grel mnyan pa dang bshad pa'i phyir bshad sbyar gyis nye bar bzung yang rigs kyi dpyod pa la sogs pa'i ni ma yin gyi bstan pa ni phan cher zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and he is also the author of the commentary on the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, which is the commentary on the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma nyid du rab tu sgrub pa'i gnas skabs su phyag 'tshal ba byed pa ni bgegs med par bsam pa mthar phyin pa'i phyir yin no zhes kha cig zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma nyid du rab tu sgrub pa'i gnas skabs su phyag 'tshal ba byed pa ni bgegs med par bsam pa mthar phyin pa'i phyir yin no zhes kha cig zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Some say that the homage is made in the context of establishing the validity of the Bhagavat himself, because it is the completion of the thought without obstruction.

original: phyag 'tshal ba lus bgegs med pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba lus bgegs med pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not correct, because there is no valid cognition for the claim that homage is the absence of obstruction to the body.

original: ya rabs rnams phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis bstan bcos la 'jug pa na bgegs nye bar zhi bar 'dod par mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: ya rabs rnams phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis bstan bcos la 'jug pa na bgegs nye bar zhi bar 'dod par mthong ba yin la /
translated: It is seen that the desire to pacify obstructions when one begins a treatise is preceded by homage by the righteous.

original: de ltar rtogs pa po 'di rnams 'jug pa yang tshad ma med par mi 'byung ba ma yin nam ;
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa po 'di rnams 'jug pa yang tshad ma med par mi 'byung ba ma yin nam ;
translated: Thus, the one who understands these things does not engage in them without valid knowledge.

original: 'bras bu las rgyu ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu las rgyu ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa yin la /
translated: The cause is known from the effect, and the effect is known from the cause.

original: 'bras bu bgegs nye bar zhi ba ni phyag 'tshal ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu bgegs nye bar zhi ba ni phyag 'tshal ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The effect of the cause is the pacification of obstacles, which is the effect of paying homage.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma yin par yang 'jug pa yod do //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma yin par yang 'jug pa yod do //
translated: But there is engagement that is not the effect of valid knowledge.

original: mi rigs te rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rigs te rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not correct, because the engagement of those who have understanding is the effect of valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa'i rtog pa dang ldan ba'i 'jug pa nyid mi shes pa las gcig pa las gcig nyen pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa'i rtog pa dang ldan ba'i 'jug pa nyid mi shes pa las gcig pa las gcig nyen pa yin no //
translated: The effect of valid knowledge is the engagement of those who have understanding, and that is different from the engagement of those who do not have understanding.

original: bden te tshad ma gang kho na las bcom ldan 'das thams cad gzigs par grub pa de kho na bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa @11a * //üîΩyang yin no //
analyzed: bden te tshad ma gang kho na las bcom ldan 'das thams cad gzigs par grub pa de kho na bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa @11a * //üîΩyang yin no //
translated: It is true that the Blessed One is the unsurpassed field of merit from the very valid knowledge by which he is known as the omniscient one.

original: des na de la phyag 'tshal ba bsgrub par 'dod pas de nyid la grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de la phyag 'tshal ba bsgrub par 'dod pas de nyid la grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to accomplish the salutation to the Blessed One should do just that.

original: de lta na yang tshigs su bcad pa 'don pa la sogs par ma gtogs par yang aa tha'i sgra rjes su bstan pa la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshigs su bcad pa 'don pa la sogs par ma gtogs par yang aa tha'i sgra rjes su bstan pa la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: Even so, the word ‚Äúnow‚Äù is not used in the recitation of verses, etc., but rather in the exposition, just as the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is used in the expression ‚Äúetc.

original: dben par lus dang ngag la sogs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das mngon par mchod nas 'jug pa yang 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben par lus dang ngag la sogs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das mngon par mchod nas 'jug pa yang 'dod pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having worshipped the Blessed One with body, speech, and mind in solitude, one should enter into the treatise in order to accomplish one‚Äôs aims.

original: de 'don pa ni 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: de 'don pa ni 'bras bu med do //
translated: But the recitation of the verses is fruitless.

original: de lta na ci'i don du tshigs su bcad pa 'don /
analyzed: de lta na ci'i don du tshigs su bcad pa 'don /
translated: For what purpose, then, are the verses recited?

original: gzhan gyi don du ste gzhan po rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das la dad pa med par yang blta bar 'dod pas bstan bcos la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du ste gzhan po rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das la dad pa med par yang blta bar 'dod pas bstan bcos la 'jug pa na /
translated: For the sake of others, since others also wish to see the Blessed One with faith. When one enters into the treatise,

original: ji lta bu'i 'dod pas kyang dang por phyag 'tshal ba skyo dub med par bsnyen pas bsod nams kyi snod du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i 'dod pas kyang dang por phyag 'tshal ba skyo dub med par bsnyen pas bsod nams kyi snod du 'gyur te /
translated: one should first pay homage to the Blessed One with a mind free from weariness, for one will then become a vessel of merit.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'am dngos kun min pas sam //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'am dngos kun min pas sam //
translated: Not according to one‚Äôs wishes, nor with all things,

original: gzhan rjes su 'brangs pa'am yid gnyis kyis kyang rung //
analyzed: gzhan rjes su 'brangs pa'am yid gnyis kyis kyang rung //
translated: or even with doubt.

original: thub dbang zla ba khyod la gang zhig phyag byed pa //
analyzed: thub dbang zla ba khyod la gang zhig phyag byed pa //
translated: Whoever pays homage to you, O Moon among Munis,

original: des kyang 'chi med phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: des kyang 'chi med phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: will attain the perfection of immortality.

original: zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi don du phyag byas pa la rang gi don gyi bgegs med pa yang zhar la grub po //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi don du phyag byas pa la rang gi don gyi bgegs med pa yang zhar la grub po //
translated: Thus, the non-obstruction of one's own aim is also established incidentally in the homage for the sake of others.

original: yang na gang las 'di lta bu'i bstan bcos bya bar nus pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yin pa de las bgegs med pa yang yin pa ni gzhan gyi don nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yang na gang las 'di lta bu'i bstan bcos bya bar nus pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yin pa de las bgegs med pa yang yin pa ni gzhan gyi don nyid yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Or, the non-obstruction of that merit-accumulation from which such a treatise can be composed is itself the aim of others. This is taught:

original: 'di la bstan bcos kyi dang por zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la bstan bcos kyi dang por zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, at the beginning of the treatise...

original: bstan bcos kyi don nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar yang bstan bcos kyi don rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar yang bstan bcos kyi don rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the aim of the treatise is to be understood as because of being the very meaning of the treatise,

original: de la mod kyi dgos pa ste gzhan gyi don yin la de bstan bcos kyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mod kyi dgos pa ste gzhan gyi don yin la de bstan bcos kyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but rather the aim of the treatise is the aim of others, which is the meaning of the treatise.

original: gang gi bstod pa yin pa de de bzhin du de'i bstan bcos yin pa bzhin du bstod pa yang gzhan gyi don yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi bstod pa yin pa de de bzhin du de'i bstan bcos yin pa bzhin du bstod pa yang gzhan gyi don yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the praise is the treatise of the one who is praised, so too the praise is for the benefit of others.

original: yang na phyag byas pa las bgegs med pas bstan bcos yongs su rdzogs pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na phyag byas pa las bgegs med pas bstan bcos yongs su rdzogs pa yin la /
translated: Or else, since there is no obstacle to the homage, the treatise is completed.

original: des na phyag 'tshal ba bstan bcos kyi don yin no //
analyzed: des na phyag 'tshal ba bstan bcos kyi don yin no //
translated: Thus, the homage is the meaning of the treatise.

original: yang na tshigs su bcad pa 'don pa la sogs pa med par yang dben par bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa la sogs pas rang gi don 'grub pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na tshigs su bcad pa 'don pa la sogs pa med par yang dben par bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa la sogs pas rang gi don 'grub pa yin la /
translated: Or else, even without reciting verses, etc., one accomplishes one's own goal by making offerings to the Blessed One in a secluded place, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'don ba ni bstan bcos kyi don yin pas gzhan gyi don yin @11b no ;
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'don ba ni bstan bcos kyi don yin pas gzhan gyi don yin @11b no ;
translated: Reciting verses is for the sake of others, since it is the meaning of the treatise.

original: / gzhan rnams kyang ji ltar 'dod pas kyang rung ste bcom ldan 'das la phyag byed pa ni rang gi don thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gzhan rnams kyang ji ltar 'dod pas kyang rung ste bcom ldan 'das la phyag byed pa ni rang gi don thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And others, as they wish, by paying homage to the Blessed One, will attain their own goal.

original: gzhan rnams kyang dbang byed pa dad dbang mi byed pa dag las dbang mi byed par rtogs pa bskyed par dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyang dbang byed pa dad dbang mi byed pa dag las dbang mi byed par rtogs pa bskyed par dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: and it is difficult to generate the understanding that the others are not controlling faculties with regard to those that are not controlled by them.

original: bstan bcos kyi dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, with regard to the treatise, the Exalted One is praised,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: and not the others.üîΩAnd the result of the praise is the same as before.

original: de la bstod pa'i 'bras bu yang snga ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas bstan bcos kyi don yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la bstod pa'i 'bras bu yang snga ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas bstan bcos kyi don yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: With this thought in mind, he says, ‚Äúbecause it is the meaning of the treatise,‚Äù and so on.

original: bstan bcos ni rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yang bstan bcos kyi don ni dam bcas pa'i ngo bo'i tshigs su bcad pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos ni rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yang bstan bcos kyi don ni dam bcas pa'i ngo bo'i tshigs su bcad pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The treatise is to be understood, and so the meaning of the treatise is the verse that is the essence of the promise.

original: dad pa'i yul nyid la phyag bya bar bstan pas bcom ldan 'das nyid la ltos par rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dad pa'i yul nyid la phyag bya bar bstan pas bcom ldan 'das nyid la ltos par rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Since it is taught that homage is to be paid to the very object of faith, those who are inclined to consider the Exalted One himself should understand that the treatise is not the work of the master.

original: slob dpon gyi gzhung ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gzhung ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: slob dpon gyi gzhung bshad pa'i sgo nas kyang bcom ldan 'das nyid rtogs par bya ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gzhung bshad pa'i sgo nas kyang bcom ldan 'das nyid rtogs par bya ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the Lord himself is to be understood through the explanation of the Master's treatise,

original: de lta rtogs par byed pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta rtogs par byed pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is because there is no need to understand it in that way.

original: gzhung de bshad pas 'phangs pa nyid las tshad ma nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa nyid du mi nus so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhung de bshad pas 'phangs pa nyid las tshad ma nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa nyid du mi nus so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that it is not possible to understand the validity of the treatise just as it is through the explanation of the treatise itself.

original: tshul bzhin zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: tshul bzhin zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: Properly means in accordance with the treatise.

original: / yang na phyed snga mas bcom ldan 'das nyid la ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: / yang na phyed snga mas bcom ldan 'das nyid la ltos pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, the first half shows that it is dependent on the Lord himself.

original: phyed phyi mas kyang rgyu dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: phyed phyi mas kyang rgyu dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: The second half shows that it is also dependent on the cause.

original: de nyid kyis na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir tshad ma grub pa nyid sgrub par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir tshad ma grub pa nyid sgrub par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because it is dependent, the establishment of the validity of the treatise is accomplished.

original: slob dpon gyi gzhung ni ma yin no //üîΩphyed snga mas ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gzhung ni ma yin no // phyed snga mas ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: But it is not the Master's treatise.üîΩThe first half is the reason.

original: phyi mas ni dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi mas ni dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: The second half is the thesis and the conclusion.

original: de ltar na yang phyag byas pas rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don nyid zhar la grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang phyag byas pas rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don nyid zhar la grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by paying homage, one accomplishes one‚Äôs own aim and the aim of others as well.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten la grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten la grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are perception and the rest not established for the world?

original: de'i nang du 'dus pa bcom ldan 'das kyang grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i nang du 'dus pa bcom ldan 'das kyang grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the Lord Buddha is included among them, he is not to be examined.

original: log par rtogs pa la brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa la brtag pa yin no //
translated: The examination is of the false imagination.

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: It is not because of the inability of the world to understand.

original: de rnams kyis brtag pa ni phan tshun brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyis brtag pa ni phan tshun brten pa yin no //
translated: The examination by them is mutually dependent.

original: gal te gzhan rnams kyis yin na de rnams kyis ji ltar yin /
analyzed: gal te gzhan rnams kyis yin na de rnams kyis ji ltar yin /
translated: If it is by others, how is it by them?

original: gal te de las kyang gzhan pa rnams kyis yin na ni thub pa med par 'gyur @12a * //
analyzed: gal te de las kyang gzhan pa rnams kyis yin na ni thub pa med par 'gyur @12a * //
translated: If it is by others than those, there is an infinite regress.üîΩThe examination is of the nonestablished by the well established.

original: ro ; / rab tu grub pa rnams kyis ma grub pa brtag pa yin no zhe na ma yin te zhes mtshan nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir de lta bu nyid bsgrub par bya bar mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ro ; / rab tu grub pa rnams kyis ma grub pa brtag pa yin no zhe na ma yin te zhes mtshan nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir de lta bu nyid bsgrub par bya bar mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: No, because the characteristics are the same. Thus, it is shown that such cannot be established.

original: 'o na ji ltar de yod pa gsal bar byas nas yod pa la yang dag par sbyor ba'i skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de yod pa gsal bar byas nas yod pa la yang dag par sbyor ba'i skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa ji ltar yin /
translated: Well then, how is it that you say, ‚ÄúThe person who, having clarified the existence of that, is correctly engaged in existence‚Äù?

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mngon sum gyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa de yongs su brtag ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mngon sum gyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa de yongs su brtag ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of non-erroneous perception is taught, but it is not imagined.

original: yongs su brtag pa nyid dgag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa nyid dgag pa yin gyi /
translated: Imagination is negated.

original: yongs su brtag pa bzhin du mtshan nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa bzhin du mtshan nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The characteristic is not like imagination.

original: 'jig rten la grub pa de bzhin du rtogs pa la mi nus pa la de skad smra ba yin na ni ;
analyzed: 'jig rten la grub pa de bzhin du rtogs pa la mi nus pa la de skad smra ba yin na ni ;
translated: If you say that just as it is established in the world, it is not possible to understand it in that way,

original: yongs su brtag pa yang de bzhin du mi rigs te /
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa yang de bzhin du mi rigs te /
translated: then it is not reasonable to imagine it in that way.

original: rab tu grub pas ma grub pa yongs su brtag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu grub pas ma grub pa yongs su brtag pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that the non-established is imagined by the established is:

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The understanding of the object depends on valid cognition.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not depend on invalid cognition.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa dang mtshan nyid mi 'dre ba nyid la tshad mar yongs su brtag pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa dang mtshan nyid mi 'dre ba nyid la tshad mar yongs su brtag pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is a nonvalid cognition and that it is a misapprehension of the definition of valid cognition.

original: ma 'khrul pa nye bar bstan pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa de ma nges pa'i phyir lan gyi tshul gyis yongs su brtag pa'i shugs kyis bstan pas brjod bya ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa nye bar bstan pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa de ma nges pa'i phyir lan gyi tshul gyis yongs su brtag pa'i shugs kyis bstan pas brjod bya ma yin nam /
translated: Since the definition of nondeceptive is not ascertained, is it not the case that the definition is not stated because it is implied by the response?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: mtshan nyid brjod pa nyid log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du yongs su brtag pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //üîΩtshad ma rnams la yon tan dang mi slu ba'i shes pa la ltos nas yongs su brtag pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid brjod pa nyid log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du yongs su brtag pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no // tshad ma rnams la yon tan dang mi slu ba'i shes pa la ltos nas yongs su brtag pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: The definition is stated for the purpose of eliminating misconceptions, not for the purpose of implying something else.

original: thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable to impute that valid cognitions are nondeceptive in reliance on a subsequent consciousness because that would be an infinite regress.

original: ma yin te de bkag pas tshad ma nyid dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin te de bkag pas tshad ma nyid dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: No, it is not. It would follow that the distinction between valid cognition and the other would not exist because that is refuted. This will be explained later.

original: tshad ma la rag las pa yin gyi shes pa la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma la rag las pa yin gyi shes pa la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is dependent on valid knowledge, not on consciousness.

original: myu gu ni sa bon la rag las pa yin gyi /
analyzed: myu gu ni sa bon la rag las pa yin gyi /
translated: A sprout is dependent on a seed,

original: sa bon gyi shes pa la rag las pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi shes pa la rag las pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not dependent on the consciousness of the seed.

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa nyid las yin gyi tshad ma nyid du ma rtogs pa las rtogs pa'i yul don du gnyer ba rnams 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa nyid las yin gyi tshad ma nyid du ma rtogs pa las rtogs pa'i yul don du gnyer ba rnams 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, those who seek an object that is the domain of realization engage in it because of realization, not because of valid knowledge.

original: rtogs pa tsam ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
translated: Mere realization is not a limb of engagement,

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to a dream, etc.

original: phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩde dang 'brel bas de yin pa de lta na'ang nyid las shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na / de dang 'brel bas de yin pa de lta na'ang nyid las shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that it is because of the connection with the object of engagement,

original: gzhan nyid las yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan nyid las yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: even though it is that because of the connection with it, it is known to be from something else, because it is not from itself.

original: sreg pa la sogs @12b pa'i shes pa yang sreg pa la sogs pa grub pa'i ched kyi thabs nyid kyis 'dod pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sreg pa la sogs @12b pa'i shes pa yang sreg pa la sogs pa grub pa'i ched kyi thabs nyid kyis 'dod pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness of burning, etc. is also asserted to be the means of accomplishing burning, etc., but not its nature.

original: skyes bu'i don ma yin pa'i phyir dang phrad pa nyid mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ma yin pa'i phyir dang phrad pa nyid mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: because it is not the object of a person, and because it would follow, absurdly, that contact itself would not be engaged in.

original: 'phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i shes pa yang mi shes pa la phrad pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i shes pa yang mi shes pa la phrad pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of the connection of the object of contact is not possible in the case of the noncognizer.

original: 'dir 'di'o zhes phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa rig pa yin gyi gcig po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'di'o zhes phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa rig pa yin gyi gcig po ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is the awareness of the connection of the object of contact that is the cognition, not the single cognition.

original: de nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: This is the refutation.

original: phrad par bya ba'i shes pa nyid las de don du gnyer ba po 'jug par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba'i shes pa nyid las de don du gnyer ba po 'jug par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the cognition of the object of contact itself causes the seeker to engage in the object,

original: de'i 'brel ba shes pa bar gyi sha ltag gis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i 'brel ba shes pa bar gyi sha ltag gis ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of the cognition of the connection of the object of contact?

original: phrad par bya ba rtogs pa yang gzhal bya rtogs pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad par bya ba rtogs pa yang gzhal bya rtogs pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the object of contact is the cognition of the object to be measured, not the cognition of its mere nature.

original: phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa de las de rtogs pa kho na 'brel pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa de las de rtogs pa kho na 'brel pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition of the nature of the object of contact is the cognition of the connection of the object of contact, then the cognition of the object of contact is the cognition of the connection of the object of contact.

original: gcig rig pa las ni ma yin gyi 'brel pa rig pa las yin te /
analyzed: gcig rig pa las ni ma yin gyi 'brel pa rig pa las yin te /
translated: It is not that one knows the connection from knowing the one, but rather one knows the connection from knowing the connection.

original: du ba tsam rig pa las me dang 'brel pa rig pa ma yin gyi me mthong nas du ba ma mthong ba na mthong ba'i stobs dang ma mthong ba'i stobs las de las 'di'o zhes nges bzhin pa'i du ba ni 'brel pa can nyid du nges pa yin
analyzed: du ba tsam rig pa las me dang 'brel pa rig pa ma yin gyi me mthong nas du ba ma mthong ba na mthong ba'i stobs dang ma mthong ba'i stobs las de las 'di'o zhes nges bzhin pa'i du ba ni 'brel pa can nyid du nges pa yin
translated: It is not that one knows the connection of fire from merely knowing smoke, but rather one knows the connection of fire from smoke when one sees fire and does not see smoke, and one knows that smoke is connected to fire from the power of seeing and the power of not seeing.

original: te / mthong ba goms pa kho na las so //
analyzed: te / mthong ba goms pa kho na las so //
translated: One knows the connection from merely seeing and becoming accustomed to it.

original: 'dir yang phrad par bya ba la lta ba po rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa ni /üîΩde las 'di'o zhes de kho na bzhin du rtogs pa po goms pas kyang rang gi ngo bo mthong ba kho na las so //
analyzed: 'dir yang phrad par bya ba la lta ba po rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa ni / de las 'di'o zhes de kho na bzhin du rtogs pa po goms pas kyang rang gi ngo bo mthong ba kho na las so //
translated: Here, the seer who sees the object of observation of its own entityüîΩknows it is from that in the same way, and the one who knows it is from that becomes accustomed to it.

original: goms pa med pa la ni de'i 'grel pa gzhan nyid kho na las yin par shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: goms pa med pa la ni de'i 'grel pa gzhan nyid kho na las yin par shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: One should understand that it is from merely seeing its own entity.

original: rang gi ngo bo shes pa las ni ma yin no //üîΩde dag tsam na du ba las rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo shes pa las ni ma yin no //üîΩde dag tsam na du ba las rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ste /
translated: It is not from knowing its own entity.üîΩWhen one sees smoke, one knows the connection of fire from smoke.

original: 'bras bu du ba nyid las goms kyang rung ma goms kyang rung bas shes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu du ba nyid las goms kyang rung ma goms kyang rung bas shes pa yin la /
translated: Even if one is familiar with the effect, smoke, or not familiar with it, it is known.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni phrad par bya ba'i 'bras bu de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni phrad par bya ba'i 'bras bu de nyid kyis so //
translated: Its own nature is known by that very effect to be contacted.

original: 'bras dang rgyu nyid kyi de nyid mthong ba yang rgyun gcig tu gnas pa'i skad cig ma rnams gcig tu 'dus pas gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba yang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras dang rgyu nyid kyi de nyid mthong ba yang rgyun gcig tu gnas pa'i skad cig ma rnams gcig tu 'dus pas gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba yang ngo //
translated: Seeing the reality of cause and effect is also seeing the form, etc. that endures as a single entity through the aggregation of moments in a single continuum.

original: de ltar phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo shes pa de nyid ni phrad par bya ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo shes pa de nyid ni phrad par bya ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: That very cognition of the nature related to the object to be contacted is the cognition of the object to be contacted.

original: de nyid kyang gzhal bya rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gzhal bya rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And that is the realization of the object to be cognized.

original: tshad ma'i shes pa nyid ni gzhal bya rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i shes pa nyid ni gzhal bya rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of valid knowledge is the realization of the object to be cognized.

original: tshad ma'i shes pa med na gzhal bya rtogs pa ga la yod /üîΩyang na mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin gyi log @13a * //
analyzed: tshad ma'i shes pa med na gzhal bya rtogs pa ga la yod / yang na mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin gyi log @13a * //
translated: Without the cognition of valid knowledge, how can there be realization of the object to be cognized?

original: par rtogs pa pos go ba de tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: par rtogs pa pos go ba de tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, the definition is the teaching of its own nature, not just the understanding by one who has wrong understanding.

original: sgrub par byed par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the realization of the object that is the proof,

original: de lta yin na yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba'i don la 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba'i don la 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: then you have come to the meaning of ‚Äúcomplete investigation.‚Äù

original: yang na tshad ma zhes bya ba ni med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na tshad ma zhes bya ba ni med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Or else, the so-called valid cognition does not exist at all,

original: ma 'khrul ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no non-erroneous cognition, etc.üîΩTherefore, there is no such thing as complete investigation at all.

original: des na yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med do zhes chad ma thams cad med par smra ba'i rgol ba rnams sems pa la gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des na yongs su brtag pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med do zhes chad ma thams cad med par smra ba'i rgol ba rnams sems pa la gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, the nihilists who deny everything think, but we say that the realization of the object depends on valid cognition.

original: tshad ma ni yod pa yin te slu ba med par mthong ba la sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma ni yod pa yin te slu ba med par mthong ba la sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that valid cognition exists because there is non-deceptive seeing, etc.üîΩSince there is no valid cognition that is not direct perception,

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma ni med ces bya bas /üîΩrjes su dpag pa med par smra ba'i rgol ba po'i bye brag go //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma ni med ces bya bas /üîΩrjes su dpag pa med par smra ba'i rgol ba po'i bye brag go //
translated: there are some who argue that there is no inference.

original: yang na bde bar gshegs pa'i gzhung lugs su rnam par rig pa tsam yin la de nyid du dngos su 'am brgyud pas kyang rung mthar thug pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na bde bar gshegs pa'i gzhung lugs su rnam par rig pa tsam yin la de nyid du dngos su 'am brgyud pas kyang rung mthar thug pa yin la /
translated: Or, in the scriptures of the Sugata, it is mere awareness, and it is ultimately real, either directly or indirectly.

original: de la yang gzhal bya med pa'i phyir slu ba med pa nyid dam gzhan yang rung bas 'dis dpag par bya ba yin zhes de la dmigs pa'i tshad ma nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: de la yang gzhal bya med pa'i phyir slu ba med pa nyid dam gzhan yang rung bas 'dis dpag par bya ba yin zhes de la dmigs pa'i tshad ma nyid mi srid do //
translated: And since there is no object of comprehension, it is nondeceptive, or it is something else. Therefore, it is not possible for it to be a valid cognition that observes that.

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pas ni tshad ma nyid ma yin la phrad par bya ba'i don rig pa ni tshad ma nyid yin te ;
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pas ni tshad ma nyid ma yin la phrad par bya ba'i don rig pa ni tshad ma nyid yin te ;
translated: Awareness of its own nature is not valid knowledge, but awareness of an object that is to be contacted is valid knowledge.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: tshad ma nyid dam tshad ma min nyid dam //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid dam tshad ma min nyid dam //
translated: Validity, invalidity,

original: bsod nams sdigs pa sogs dang de 'bras bu //
analyzed: bsod nams sdigs pa sogs dang de 'bras bu //
translated: Merit, demerit, and so on, and their effects,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs de dag thams cad kyang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs de dag thams cad kyang //
translated: All of these

original: don gyis stong pa'i blo la mi rigs 'gyur //üîΩzhes bstan to zhes zer ba 'di la /
analyzed: don gyis stong pa'i blo la mi rigs 'gyur // zhes bstan to zhes zer ba 'di la /
translated: Are not tenable in a mind that is empty of objects.

original: tshad ma la rag las pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma la rag las pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to this, it is said that it is dependent on valid knowledge.

original: phrad par bya ba dang 'brel ba nyid ni 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba dang 'brel ba nyid ni 'jig rten pa'i tshad ma yin la /
translated: The connection with the object of contact is the mundane valid cognition.

original: de rig pa tsam yang khyad par can ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rig pa tsam yang khyad par can ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mere awareness of that is not special.

original: yin du zin kyang rig byed la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la tshad ma yin par 'jig rten du grub po zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtag pa'i go skabs med pa yin te /
analyzed: yin du zin kyang rig byed la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la tshad ma yin par 'jig rten du grub po zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtag pa'i go skabs med pa yin te /
translated: Even if it were, it is not possible to investigate the opportunity that the Vedas, etc. are established in the world as valid cognition regarding another world, etc.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das nyid ni //
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das nyid ni //
translated: Here, the Blessed One himself

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: says this.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi rgyu mtshan gnyis sam bsgrub par bya ba de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi rgyu mtshan gnyis sam bsgrub par bya ba de la'o //
translated: There refers to the two reasons in the context or the probandum.

original: de la yang dbye ba rnam pa bzhi yod de //
analyzed: de la yang dbye ba rnam pa bzhi yod de //
translated: There are also four types of distinctions.

original: @13b bcom ldan 'das nyid chos la tshad ma yin pa'am gzhan nyid dam gnyi ga 'am gnyi ga ma yin pa zhig ces yongs su brtag pa tshol ba la /
analyzed: @13b bcom ldan 'das nyid chos la tshad ma yin pa'am gzhan nyid dam gnyi ga 'am gnyi ga ma yin pa zhig ces yongs su brtag pa tshol ba la /
translated: Investigating whether the Blessed One himself is the valid cognition regarding the Dharma or something else, or both, or neither,

original: 'dir rnam pa 'di gzhir byed par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa 'di gzhir byed par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: here this aspect becomes the basis.

original: de la phyogs gsum po bsal nas phyogs dang po yongs su bzung bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la phyogs gsum po bsal nas phyogs dang po yongs su bzung bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Having eliminated the three positions, he teaches the first position to be completely unacceptable.

original: tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma yang bcom ldan 'das nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe valid cognition is the Bhagavat himself‚Äù teaches this.

original: gzhan nyid las skyes pa'i tshad ma nyid de yang rang gi 'bras bu la mi ltos pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan nyid las skyes pa'i tshad ma nyid de yang rang gi 'bras bu la mi ltos pa nyid yin la /
translated: And that valid cognition which arises from something else does not depend on its own effect.üîΩAnd the effect is not the ascertainment or engagement of the object as it is.üîΩThe former is the ascertainment of the object as it is, which is seen to arise in the interval between the arising of the effect, the cognition.

original: 'bras bu yang de'i don ji lta ba la nges pa'am 'jug pa ma yin nam de la snga ma ni 'bras bu'i shes pa byung ba'i dus nyid la bar du mchod par skye par mthong ba la 'jug par bya ba yang don ji lta ba la nges pa'i
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de'i don ji lta ba la nges pa'am 'jug pa ma yin nam de la snga ma ni 'bras bu'i shes pa byung ba'i dus nyid la bar du mchod par skye par mthong ba la 'jug par bya ba yang don ji lta ba la nges pa'i
translated: The latter is the engagement in the object as it is, which is seen to arise in the interval between the arising of the effect, the ascertainment.

original: rgyu mtshan de yod na 'byung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de yod na 'byung ba nyid yin te /
translated: If that reason exists, it arises.

original: ltos pa gzhan yang rgyu'i yon tan gyi shes pa nyid yin no zhe na //
analyzed: ltos pa gzhan yang rgyu'i yon tan gyi shes pa nyid yin no zhe na //
translated: And the other dependence is the cognition of the quality of the cause.

original: de yang tshad ma yin na ltos pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma la /
analyzed: de yang tshad ma yin na ltos pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma la /
translated: If that is also valid cognition, it is a dependence, but not otherwise.

original: des na yang de'i yang ltos pa yon tan gyi shes pa gzhan yin la /
analyzed: des na yang de'i yang ltos pa yon tan gyi shes pa gzhan yin la /
translated: Therefore, the dependence of that is also the other cognition of the quality.

original: de'i yang gzhan yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yang gzhan yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that is also different from the former, so there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te ltos pa las ltos byed tshad ma yin na ltos byed kyang gzhan las zhes pa la skyon med do //
analyzed: 'on te ltos pa las ltos byed tshad ma yin na ltos byed kyang gzhan las zhes pa la skyon med do //
translated: But if a valid cognition is a valid cognition in reliance on another, then the other is also in reliance on another, so there is no fault.

original: ma yin te phan tshun brten par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yin te phan tshun brten par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: No, because it would follow that they are mutually dependent.

original: bdag nyid thob pa la yang rgyu'i yon tan la ltos pa yin gyi rang gi 'bras bu la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thob pa la yang rgyu'i yon tan la ltos pa yin gyi rang gi 'bras bu la ni ma yin te /
translated: When one obtains an object, it is in reliance on the quality of the cause, but not in reliance on its own effect.

original: bum pa la rdza mkhan la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bum pa la rdza mkhan la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a pot is in reliance on a potter, etc.

original: mi slu ba'i shes pa'i ltos pa la yang ste /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i shes pa'i ltos pa la yang ste /
translated: Also, a nondeceptive consciousness is in reliance on its object.

original: 'di nyid kyang sun 'don pa gnyis dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyang sun 'don pa gnyis dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the two refutations.

original: skad cig ma'i rnam par shes pa ni yon tan mi slu ba'i shes pa'i dus su gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rnam par shes pa ni yon tan mi slu ba'i shes pa'i dus su gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: A momentary consciousness does not exist at the time of a nondeceptive consciousness.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa'i tshad ma nyid ltos pa dang bcas par 'gal bas khas len par mi rigs pa'i phyir gyi shugs kyis ltos pa med pa nyid du grub po ;
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa'i tshad ma nyid ltos pa dang bcas par 'gal bas khas len par mi rigs pa'i phyir gyi shugs kyis ltos pa med pa nyid du grub po ;
translated: Therefore, since it is contradictory for a valid cognition that is accepted as a valid cognition to be in reliance, it is not correct to accept it.

original: / de yang /
analyzed: / de yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gcig bu ltos med kho na nyid //
analyzed: gcig bu ltos med kho na nyid //
translated: It is the one and only, independent reality.

original: mtshan ma nyid ni rgyu mtshan ste //üîΩltos bcas nyid la yang dag par //
analyzed: mtshan ma nyid ni rgyu mtshan ste // ltos bcas nyid la yang dag par //
translated: The very sign is the reason.üîΩIf it is established in dependence,

original: gnas na de nyid rnam nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas na de nyid rnam nyams 'gyur //
translated: It will be destroyed by reality.

original: gang phyir rtsa ba'i phyogs dor nas //
analyzed: gang phyir rtsa ba'i phyogs dor nas //
translated: Since the root position is abandoned,

original: su zhig rigs pa smra 'dod @14a * //
analyzed: su zhig rigs pa smra 'dod @14a * //
translated: Who would want to speak rationally?

original: 'gyur // gang gis de sgrub pa'i thabs kyang //
analyzed: 'gyur // gang gis de sgrub pa'i thabs kyang //
translated: The method of establishing it

original: rang gi tshig gis rnams nyams 'gyur //üîΩltos bcas tshad ma nyid du ni //
analyzed: rang gi tshig gis rnams nyams 'gyur // ltos bcas tshad ma nyid du ni //
translated: Is destroyed by one‚Äôs own words.üîΩThere is no presentation of

original: rnam par gzhag pa gang na yang med //üîΩces bya ba dang / ji ste mi bslu'i snga ma yin //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa gang na yang med // ces bya ba dang / ji ste mi bslu'i snga ma yin //
translated: Dependence as valid cognition.üîΩAnd also,üîΩIf the former is nondeceptive,

original: slu ba med can gnyis tshad nas //
analyzed: slu ba med can gnyis tshad nas //
translated: The latter, which is deceptive, is not valid.

original: phan tshun yang dag brten nyid kyis //
analyzed: phan tshun yang dag brten nyid kyis //
translated: Since they are mutually dependent,

original: tshad mar brtag bya nyid nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: tshad mar brtag bya nyid nyams 'gyur //
translated: The status of being a valid cognition is destroyed.

original: zhes kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is also taught.

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point here is this.

original: ma 'khrul ba nyid ni tshad ma nyid yin la /
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba nyid ni tshad ma nyid yin la /
translated: Nondeceptiveness is valid cognition.

original: de yang shes pa'i don dang 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang shes pa'i don dang 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is related to the object of consciousness.

original: der nges pa yang shes pa des sam shes pa gzhan gyis yin /
analyzed: der nges pa yang shes pa des sam shes pa gzhan gyis yin /
translated: And is that ascertainment by that consciousness or by another consciousness?

original: des yin na ni 'brel pa can du nges par sngon du 'gro ba can de ni shes pa yin te /
analyzed: des yin na ni 'brel pa can du nges par sngon du 'gro ba can de ni shes pa yin te /
translated: If it is by that, then it is a consciousness that precedes the ascertainment of the relation.

original: 'brel pa can du ma nges na 'brel pa mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can du ma nges na 'brel pa mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For if one does not ascertain the relation, one does not know the relation.

original: 'brel pa can yin na ni don la nges pas snga ma nyid kho na la 'jug par 'gyur na 'brel pa shes pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'brel pa can yin na ni don la nges pas snga ma nyid kho na la 'jug par 'gyur na 'brel pa shes pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If one does ascertain the relation, then one ascertains the object by the former alone, so what is the use of knowing the relation?

original: 'on te 'brel pa nges pa las 'brel pa can don la nges pa yin na phan tshun brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa nges pa las 'brel pa can don la nges pa yin na phan tshun brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the ascertainment of the object is from the ascertainment of the relation, then they would be mutually dependent.

original: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa las yin na /
analyzed: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa las yin na /
translated: But if it is from the consciousness of the object‚Äôs function,

original: de yang don byed par 'brel pa shes na /
analyzed: de yang don byed par 'brel pa shes na /
translated: then if one knows the relation to the object‚Äôs function,

original: don byed par nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: don byed par nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: then one ascertains the object‚Äôs function.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa don gyi byed pa de nyid shes pa yin na /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa don gyi byed pa de nyid shes pa yin na /
translated: If the consciousness of the object‚Äôs function in dreams and so on is itself the consciousness,

original: de la yang de las don byed pa'i shes pa gzhan brtsal bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de la yang de las don byed pa'i shes pa gzhan brtsal bar bya dgos la /
translated: then one must seek another consciousness of the object‚Äôs function in that,

original: de la yang gzhan las yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan las yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that will be from another.

original: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa gnod pa med par don byed par rig pa ni rang nyid las tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa gnod pa med par don byed par rig pa ni rang nyid las tshad ma yin no //
translated: But if a non-defective effective cognition is known to be effective, it is valid with regard to itself.

original: snga ma yang de kho na bzhin du rang gi 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i tshad ma'o //üîΩde yang ; dngos kun bdag nyid 'thob don du //
analyzed: snga ma yang de kho na bzhin du rang gi 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i tshad ma'o // de yang ; dngos kun bdag nyid 'thob don du //
translated: The former is also like that, a valid cognition that does not depend on its effect.üîΩAnd that is stated:üîΩAll entities are dependent

original: rgyu la ltos pa nyid du 'gyur //üîΩbdag nyid thob par rang 'bras la //
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa nyid du 'gyur // bdag nyid thob par rang 'bras la //
translated: on causes for the attainment of their own state.üîΩFor the attainment of their own state,

original: rang nyid 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rang nyid 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: they engage in their own effect.

original: gal te rnam shes skyes gyur na'ang //
analyzed: gal te rnam shes skyes gyur na'ang //
translated: Even if consciousness has arisen,

original: ji srid rgyu ni bdag nyid du //
analyzed: ji srid rgyu ni bdag nyid du //
translated: as long as the cause is not understood

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa //
