translated: If you assert that only the blue color is contacted, then only the shape is asserted.

original: ser po dang dkar po thun mong ba thob par 'gyur ba kho na te kha dog ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ser po dang dkar po thun mong ba thob par 'gyur ba kho na te kha dog ni ma yin no //
translated: The common acquisition of yellow and white would be only the shape, not the color.

original: 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kho na nas tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid thams cad kho na nas tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: But if the cognition is not valid in any way,

original: cha shas kyis kyang tshad ma nyid yin na ni rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa kho na tshad ma yin zhes ston par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: cha shas kyis kyang tshad ma nyid yin na ni rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa kho na tshad ma yin zhes ston par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then if it is valid in part, you cannot teach that only the conceptual cognition of inference is valid.

original: tha na sgra pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po tsam gyi cha la mi bslu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha na sgra pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po tsam gyi cha la mi bslu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even the conceptual consciousness of a grammarian is nondeceptive in regard to the mere thing.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not,

original: mi bslu ba dang bslu ba tsam gyis tshad ma dang cig shos nyid du khas len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi bslu ba dang bslu ba tsam gyis tshad ma dang cig shos nyid du khas len pa'i phyir te /
translated: because we accept that a valid cognition is merely nondeceptive and a nonvalid cognition is merely deceptive.

original: 'dod pa dang phrad par yod na tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang phrad par yod na tshad ma yin la /
translated: If one desires to meet a friend, one uses a valid cognition;

original: de med pa la ni gzhan du'o //
analyzed: de med pa la ni gzhan du'o //
translated: if one does not, one uses something else.

original: ser po'i shes pa la dbyibs dang / 'gro ba'i shing mthong ba la shing dang / gnas gzhan na yod pa'i nor bu'i shes pa nor bu dang / bden pa'i rmi lam gyi bu rnams su 'dod pa yin gyi dus la sogs par ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ser po'i shes pa la dbyibs dang / 'gro ba'i shing mthong ba la shing dang / gnas gzhan na yod pa'i nor bu'i shes pa nor bu dang / bden pa'i rmi lam gyi bu rnams su 'dod pa yin gyi dus la sogs par ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: A cognition of yellow is a valid cognition in regard to yellow, a cognition of shape is a valid cognition in regard to shape, a cognition of a tree that sees a moving tree is a valid cognition in regard to a tree, a cognition of a jewel that exists in another place is a valid cognition in regard to a jewel, and a cognition of a son in a true dream is a valid cognition in regard to a son, but they are not valid cognitions in regard to time and so on.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i cha shas la tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i cha shas la tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore they are valid cognitions in regard to the part that is desired.

original: sgra las byung ba yang mngon par 'dod pa ston pa'i phyir zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba yang mngon par 'dod pa ston pa'i phyir zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Also, that which arises from words is a valid cognition because it teaches what is desired.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam ni dngos po'i cha shas la yang tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam ni dngos po'i cha shas la yang tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: A mere conceptualization is not a valid cognition even in regard to a part of an entity,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the object that is desired.

original: 'dis ni ci nas kyang thob par byed pa ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ci nas kyang thob par byed pa ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that it does not cause one to obtain anything.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The object that is desired is an inference that has conceptualization. This is the analysis.

original: cha shas kyis ni tshad ma dang cig @26a * //üîΩshos nyid de /
analyzed: cha shas kyis ni tshad ma dang cig @26a * // shos nyid de /
translated: By a part, there is validity and priority.

original: mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa dang cig shos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the desired one and the other one.

original: byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba ni bya ba la gnas pa nyid kyis nges pa can du shes par byed pa'i phyir de nyid dang por shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba ni bya ba la gnas pa nyid kyis nges pa can du shes par byed pa'i phyir de nyid dang por shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: The action that resides in the agent is to be known first, because it is ascertained by the very fact that it resides in the action.

original: gal te de shes pa yin na byed pa po la gnas bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te de shes pa yin na byed pa po la gnas bas ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is known, what is the use of its residing in the agent?

original: de'i thabs yin pa nyid kho nas 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas don byed gnas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i thabs yin pa nyid kho nas 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas don byed gnas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The meaning of the term is that it is the means of accomplishing that.

original: phrad par bya ba shes pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba shes pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the object to be engaged is a factor of engagement, but it is not the essence of the object to be engaged.

original: byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba khas len pa nyid yin na /üîΩrang gi ngo bo smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba khas len pa nyid yin na / rang gi ngo bo smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts that the action abides in the agent,üîΩthen it would be said that the essence of the object to be engaged is the action.

original: phrad par bya ba la ltos pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni bya ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba la ltos pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni bya ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: The essence of the object to be engaged in relation to engagement is the action, but it is not the mere essence of the object to be engaged.

original: bden te / rang gi ngo bo la ni tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te / rang gi ngo bo la ni tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is true that the essence of the object to be engaged is not a valid means of knowledge,

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is too broad.

original: phrad par bya ba la ni tshad ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: phrad par bya ba la ni tshad ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intention is that the object to be engaged is a valid means of knowledge.

original: byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba khas len pa yang de nyid yin par dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba khas len pa yang de nyid yin par dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: The action that abides in the agent is also accepted as being that.

original: rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa 'ba' zhig ni ji ltar phrad par bya ba la dmigs par 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa 'ba' zhig ni ji ltar phrad par bya ba la dmigs par 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: How could the mere observation of its own nature be the observation of that which is to be contacted?

original: phrad par bya ba'i byed pa po'i shes pa tshad ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba'i byed pa po'i shes pa tshad ma yin par bstan te /
translated: In order to dispel this doubt, he demonstrates that the cognition that is the agent of contact is a valid cognition.

original: de de ltar yongs su gcod pa 'dis don go ba yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar yongs su gcod pa 'dis don go ba yin no //
translated: By this complete determination, the meaning is understood.

original: de la yang don ni 'di yin te rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa la phrad par bya ba la dmigs par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang don ni 'di yin te rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa la phrad par bya ba la dmigs par zhen pa yin no //
translated: And the meaning of this is as follows: The mere observation of its own nature is the adherence to the observation of that which is to be contacted.

original: 'on te don byed pa zhes bya bas 'jig rten pa nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te don byed pa zhes bya bas 'jig rten pa nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Or, if the term ‚Äúto perform the function of an object‚Äù demonstrates the validity of worldly cognition,

original: dang por ni de 'grub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: dang por ni de 'grub pa'i thabs so //
translated: then the first is the means of establishing that.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de la don yin par smra na 'di yang shugs kyis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don yin par smra na 'di yang shugs kyis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one asserts that to be the object, this is also established by implication.

original: skad cig ma dang po'i shes pa'am sgro btags pa yang rung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po'i shes pa'am sgro btags pa yang rung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the first moment of cognition is a superimposition?

original: 'di ni phrad par bya ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni phrad par bya ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case, because it is not that which is to be contacted.

original: phrad par bya ba yongs su bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba yongs su bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is to be contacted is completely determined.

original: de'i don nyid ji ltar go bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i don nyid ji ltar go bar 'gyur /
translated: How can you understand the meaning of that?

original: phrad pa'i shes pa ni phyi rol du zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid las rjes su dpag pa la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: phrad pa'i shes pa ni phyi rol du zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid las rjes su dpag pa la yod pa yin te /
translated: The cognition of contact exists in inference because of the nature of the adherence to external things.

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol la phrad par bya bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol la phrad par bya bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the adherence to contact with external things.

original: rang gi rnam pa 'di la phyi rol du zhen pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa 'di la phyi rol du zhen pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this form of one‚Äôs own cognition is the adherence to external things,

original: de lta yin na yang thams cad du phrad par bya bar zhen pa can yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na yang thams cad du phrad par bya bar zhen pa can yin no //
translated: then even in that case, there is the adherence to contact with external things.

original: de'i nang dang phyi rol yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i nang dang phyi rol yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is neither internal nor external,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: phyi rol @26b nyid du zhen pa'i phyir dang / grub pa'i mtha' med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol @26b nyid du zhen pa'i phyir dang / grub pa'i mtha' med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: Because of the adherence to external things and because of the consequence that there would be no philosophical theory.

original: phyi rol ni grub pa'i mtha' la yin gyi gnyi ga ma yin pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol ni grub pa'i mtha' la yin gyi gnyi ga ma yin pa la ma yin te /
translated: External things are a philosophical theory, but not both.

original: de ni rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that is self-cognition.

original: rang gi rnam pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not one‚Äôs own form.

original: mngon sum gyis gzhan du rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gzhan du rig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the cognition of another by direct perception.

original: des ni phyi rol yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des ni phyi rol yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not external.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: phyi rol dang rang gi rnam pa dag la gcig pa nyid du zhen pas gnyi ga ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol dang rang gi rnam pa dag la gcig pa nyid du zhen pas gnyi ga ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reality of the non-dual is known by the non-adherence to the external and to one‚Äôs own image as being the same.

original: de nyid la phyi rol du sgro btags pa yin na ni yang de dang phrad pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid la phyi rol du sgro btags pa yin na ni yang de dang phrad pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a superimposition of the external on that very reality, then there would be an infinite regress because of the contact with that.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa ni phyir yongs su bcad zin pa zlos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa ni phyir yongs su bcad zin pa zlos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the dependence on inference is a repetition of the determination of the external.

original: mngon sum la yang skad cig nyid la phrad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de rig pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum la yang skad cig nyid la phrad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de rig pa yod pa yin no //
translated: And in the case of perception, there is the knowledge of that because of the contact with the instant.

original: 'o na ni shes pa gnyis pa thob pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na ni shes pa gnyis pa thob pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there the attainment of a second cognition?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: gcig la shes pa gnyis rim gyis par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la shes pa gnyis rim gyis par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logical that two cognitions occur in one in succession.

original: gnyis pa ni gzhan ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzhan ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the second is not different.

original: de nyid de dang phrad pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de dang phrad pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gnyis pa yin no //
translated: That very thing is in contact with that, and because it is not different, how can there be a second?

original: 'jig rten pa'i ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma tha dad pa'i snga ma la yang de nyid dang phyi ma la yang de nyid du shes pa'i phyir gnyis pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma tha dad pa'i snga ma la yang de nyid dang phyi ma la yang de nyid du shes pa'i phyir gnyis pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is not a worldly [cognition], it is the second [moment] because it cognizes the same as before and the same as after, even though the moments are different.

original: de lta na yang de la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: Even so, it does not depend on that,

original: snga ma dang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is no different from the former [moment].

original: brtan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brtan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is stable,

original: de ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: it is nothing at all.

original: des ni don byed nus par shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des ni don byed nus par shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is known to be able to perform a function,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not so,

original: snga ma kho nas de dag tsam du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma kho nas de dag tsam du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the former [moment] alone is known to be just that.

original: mi gzhan gyi shes pa la ltos pas ni skad cig ma yang shes pa gnyis pa rung ba nyid yod pa'i phyir phrad par bya ba nyid ma nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gzhan gyi shes pa la ltos pas ni skad cig ma yang shes pa gnyis pa rung ba nyid yod pa'i phyir phrad par bya ba nyid ma nyams pa yin no //
translated: Because it depends on the cognition of another person, the second moment is also suitable, so the ability to contact is not lost.

original: des na pha rol po'i bshad pa la ni zlos pa nyid spangs pa med do //
analyzed: des na pha rol po'i bshad pa la ni zlos pa nyid spangs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in the opponent's explanation, there is no avoidance of repetition.

original: de'i phyir yongs su bcad nas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su bcad nas te /
translated: Therefore, having determined,

original: don dang phrad par ni rang gi ngo bo la phrad par bya ba nyid du zhen pa ste /
analyzed: don dang phrad par ni rang gi ngo bo la phrad par bya ba nyid du zhen pa ste /
translated: Meeting with the object is the conception that one's own nature meets with the object.üîΩ

original: phrad par bya ba la 'jug pa dang / phrad pa dag gi rgyu yin par gsungs pa'i phyir snga ma nyid dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad par bya ba la 'jug pa dang / phrad pa dag gi rgyu yin par gsungs pa'i phyir snga ma nyid dam pa ma yin no //
translated: The first is the best because it is said that the cause of contact is the cause of the activity of contact and the cause of contact itself.

original: mi bslu ba can nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi bslu ba can nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt nondeceptive the definition of valid knowledge?

original: shes pa ni shes pa gzhan la mi bslu bas tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: shes pa ni shes pa gzhan la mi bslu bas tshad ma yin la /
translated: A consciousness is valid knowledge because it is nondeceptive with respect to another consciousness.

original: de yang shes pa gzhan las mi bslu bas thug pa med pa'i phyir mi srid pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin du rmi lam @27a * //
analyzed: de yang shes pa gzhan las mi bslu bas thug pa med pa'i phyir mi srid pa yin no // de bzhin du rmi lam @27a * //
translated: But since that is nondeceptive with respect to another consciousness, there is an infinite regress, and it is impossible.

original: la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir khyab ches pa yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir khyab ches pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is overpervasive because it exists in the consciousnesses of dreams and so on.üîΩIt is not a pervader because there is no nondeceptive consciousness with respect to other consciousnesses, such as the object of an enemy.

original: dgra la sogs pa'i yul la yang shes pa gzhan mi bslu ba med pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa la de gnas pa de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dgra la sogs pa'i yul la yang shes pa gzhan mi bslu ba med pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa la de gnas pa de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond to that qualm, he says, ‚ÄúThat which is stable . . .‚Äù

original: gnas pa ni tshad ma ste mi g-yo ba yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa ni tshad ma ste mi g-yo ba yin la /
translated: Stability is valid knowledge, which is unwavering.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousnesses of dreams and so on are not stable.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs la sogs pa las g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs la sogs pa las g-yo ba yin no //
translated: It is displaced from the state of being awake, and so on.

original: de'i phyir khyab ches pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab ches pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the reason is too broad.

original: rnam par gnas pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa'i tshig ste /
translated: This is the section on the word ‚Äúabiding.‚Äù

original: gnas pa'i sgra smos pas ni mi srid pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i sgra smos pas ni mi srid pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: By mentioning the word ‚Äúabiding,‚Äù it is not impossible,

original: don byed pa'i shes pa 'jug pa'i bar chad med pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir khyab par byed pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa'i shes pa 'jug pa'i bar chad med pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir khyab par byed pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is abiding due to the uninterrupted engagement of the cognition that performs the function, and it is not dependent on another cognition. For that very reason, it is not the case that it is not the pervader,

original: sgra la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa nyid ni mthar thug par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa nyid ni mthar thug par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere observation of the intrinsic nature of sound, and so on, is accepted as the ultimate.

original: don byed pa'i shes pa ni dro ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba mi bslu ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: don byed pa'i shes pa ni dro ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba mi bslu ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the cognition that performs the function of heat, and so on, undeceiving?

original: de yang de las gzhan pa gang yin pa ni med pa'i phyir gang la mi bslu ba can nyid yin /
analyzed: de yang de las gzhan pa gang yin pa ni med pa'i phyir gang la mi bslu ba can nyid yin /
translated: And since there is nothing else apart from that, with respect to what is it undeceiving?

original: bden te / dngos po la dbye ba med kyang rtogs pa'i dbye ba la mi rtag pa nyid dam byas pa nyid dag gis gtan tshigs dang / gtan tshigs can nyid bzhin du mi bslu ba dang mi bslu ba can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden te / dngos po la dbye ba med kyang rtogs pa'i dbye ba la mi rtag pa nyid dam byas pa nyid dag gis gtan tshigs dang / gtan tshigs can nyid bzhin du mi bslu ba dang mi bslu ba can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: True, but even though there is no division of the thing, there is a division of the cognition, and the impermanence or the product are the reason and the thing possessing the reason, like the nondeceptive and the deceptive.

original: phrad par bya ba'i yul la tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba'i yul la tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that a valid cognition is with regard to an object to be engaged?

original: snga ma la ni rigs na phyi ma la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma la ni rigs na phyi ma la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is reasonable in the former case, but not in the latter,

original: phrad par bya ba la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa yod pa yin la /
translated: because there is no difference in the object to be engaged, and because the existent is not different.

original: snga ma ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But the former is not like that.

original: des na yang phyi ma tshad ma nyid du khas len pa yin la /
analyzed: des na yang phyi ma tshad ma nyid du khas len pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the latter is accepted as a valid cognition,

original: snga ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma ni ma yin te /
translated: but the former is not,

original: de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in that way.

original: bden te / phyi ma nyid ni phrad par bya ba la bar du chod pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma yin la snga ma ni shes pa'i cha dang / shes bya'i cha dag dang gnyi ga'i yang tha dad par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med pa kho nar tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: bden te / phyi ma nyid ni phrad par bya ba la bar du chod pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma yin la snga ma ni shes pa'i cha dang / shes bya'i cha dag dang gnyi ga'i yang tha dad par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med pa kho nar tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: True, but the latter is a valid cognition because it is not obstructed from contact with the object, while the former is a valid cognition because it is the cause of the ascertainment of nondifference, since it is the part of consciousness and the part of the object that are different.

original: de yang kha cig tu ni bden pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang kha cig tu ni bden pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, in some cases it is true,

original: kha cig tu ni sgro btags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni sgro btags pa nyid yin no //
translated: and in some cases it is superimposition.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni phrad par bya ba la tha dad pa med kyang sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni phrad par bya ba la tha dad pa med kyang sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: Inference is a superimposition, even though there is no difference in contact with the object,

original: mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: because it is not direct perception.

original: gzhan gyi de ma thag pa gzhan mthong ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi de ma thag pa gzhan mthong ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises from seeing something else immediately after something else.

original: mngon @27b sum ni gal te yang rang gi ngo bo mthong ba las byung ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: mngon @27b sum ni gal te yang rang gi ngo bo mthong ba las byung ba de lta na yang /
translated: Even though direct perception arises from seeing its own nature,üîΩit is not a superimposition.

original: phrad par bya ba dang de'i ngo bo dag rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo dang phrad par bya ba bzhin du tha dad pa med par zhen pa'i phyir tshad ma log pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phrad par bya ba dang de'i ngo bo dag rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo dang phrad par bya ba bzhin du tha dad pa med par zhen pa'i phyir tshad ma log pa nyid yin no //
translated: because the object of contact and its nature are conceived as non-different from the nature of the inference and the object of contact.

original: 'di dag tsam ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag tsam ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba yin no //
translated: This much is the difference between perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang cig shos dag gi so sor snang ba dag gi rig par bya ba la ni tha dad pa yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang cig shos dag gi so sor snang ba dag gi rig par bya ba la ni tha dad pa yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In the case of the object of awareness, which is the individual appearance of perception and inference, there is indeed a difference,

original: phrad par bya ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo rig pa nyid ni mi bslu bar rig pa yin te /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo rig pa nyid ni mi bslu bar rig pa yin te /
translated: because the awareness of its own nature by the object of contact itself is non-deceptive knowledge,

original: mi bslu bar shes pa nyid ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi bslu bar shes pa nyid ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: and non-deceptive knowledge is valid cognition.

original: des na du ba la sogs pa tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na du ba la sogs pa tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not follow that smoke and so on are valid cognitions.

original: phrad par bya ba las tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis de rig pa yang de rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir phrad par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo la dbye ba med par rtogs na /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba las tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis de rig pa yang de rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir phrad par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo la dbye ba med par rtogs na /
translated: Because the pride of manifestation that is different from the object of contact is not the cognition of that, if one understands that there is no division in the nature of the object of contact,üîΩthen it is a part of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma nyid kyi yan lag yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas gang la gzhan gyis don byed ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid kyi yan lag yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas gang la gzhan gyis don byed ces bya ba smos te /
translated: With this in mind, he says, ‚ÄúIn regard to which another performs the function,‚Äù

original: sgro btags pa'i dbye ba med pa las bden pa'i dbye ba med pa phul du byung ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i dbye ba med pa las bden pa'i dbye ba med pa phul du byung ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that the absence of a real division is the preeminent absence of a division of superimposition.

original: sgra las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba ste /
translated: Arisen from sound

original: sgras skyed pa'i shes pa ni bslu ba ma yin pa'i bsam pas smra ba pos mngon par bsams pa rtogs pa'i don dang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa'i mngon par 'dod pa ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgras skyed pa'i shes pa ni bslu ba ma yin pa'i bsam pas smra ba pos mngon par bsams pa rtogs pa'i don dang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa'i mngon par 'dod pa ston pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition produced by sound is not deceptive, because it reveals the intended object, which is the aspect that is the object of the speaker‚Äôs desire to communicate.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don ma yin nam /
translated: Is this not the meaning of ‚Äúbecause it clarifies‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir 'di la khyab par byed pa ma yin pa bsal bar /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la khyab par byed pa ma yin pa bsal bar /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the nonpervasion of this reason, he says,

original: ji skad bstan pa ji lta yin //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa ji lta yin //
translated: As it is taught, so it is.

original: gal te 'di yi don yin na //
analyzed: gal te 'di yi don yin na //
translated: If this is the meaning,üîΩthen the meaning of the statement

original: smra ba po yi bya ba yi //
analyzed: smra ba po yi bya ba yi //
translated: ‚ÄúThe activity of the speaker‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on is understood.

original: 'dis ni de nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This makes clear the meaning of that.

original: 'di nyid kyis chog mod mi gsal ba des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis chog mod mi gsal ba des ci zhig bya /
translated: This is sufficient. What is the use of the unclear?

original: bshad bya dang / bshad byed nyid yin na yang don tha dad pa nyid yin na ni mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bshad bya dang / bshad byed nyid yin na yang don tha dad pa nyid yin na ni mi rigs so zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: But if the object of expression and the means of expression are different, then it is not tenable. This is demonstrated by the passage beginning with

original: sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that has sound as its object . . .‚Äù

original: gnod pa med pa can gyi rtogs pa ni pha rol po'i 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa can gyi rtogs pa ni pha rol po'i 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the opponent accepts that the cognition is unimpaired?

original: rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa tsam gyis zhes bya bas de rtogs pa tsam ji ltar dgag pa yin /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa tsam gyis zhes bya bas de rtogs pa tsam ji ltar dgag pa yin /
translated: By saying ‚Äúmerely the cognition of its own nature,‚Äù how is that cognition alone refuted?

original: kun du rmongs pa 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'i don smra ba po'i 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa 'jig rten pa ma yin pa'i don smra ba po'i 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the speaker‚Äôs intention is to dispel the confusion of worldly people.

original: @28a * // de rnams kyis kyang kun du rmongs pa la sogs pa dang bral bar rtogs pa'i yul du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @28a * // de rnams kyis kyang kun du rmongs pa la sogs pa dang bral bar rtogs pa'i yul du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they also accept that the object of a cognition free from delusion and so on is a real object.üîΩThis is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúa cognition that is not undermined.‚Äù

original: de nyid gnod pa med pa can gyi rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa'i bye brag med pa'i rtogs pa tsam tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gnod pa med pa can gyi rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa'i bye brag med pa'i rtogs pa tsam tshad ma yin te /
translated: A mere cognition that is not undermined is a valid cognition.

original: de yang yon tan gyis bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yon tan gyis bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not produced by good qualities,

original: skyon las kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon las kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises even from faults.

original: skyon gyis bskyed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon gyis bskyed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not produced by faults,

original: de med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises even in the absence of faults.

original: dmigs kyis bsal bas 'ba' zhig dmigs kyis bsal ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal bas 'ba' zhig dmigs kyis bsal ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is an exception to the general rule,

original: spyir btang ba las byung ba kho na tshad ma yin no zhes kha cig zer ro //üîΩde la rang gi ngo bo rtogs tsam gyis //
analyzed: spyir btang ba las byung ba kho na tshad ma yin no zhes kha cig zer ro // de la rang gi ngo bo rtogs tsam gyis //
translated: some say that only what is derived from an exception is a valid cognition.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, the root text states, ‚ÄúIt is merely the realization of its own nature.‚Äù

original: de yang dmigs kyis bsal ba'i yul yongs su spangs pa las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang dmigs kyis bsal ba'i yul yongs su spangs pa las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, it is derived from the exclusion of the object that is an exception.

original: spyir btang ba'i yul nyid mthar thug pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyir btang ba'i yul nyid mthar thug pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object of the ordinary person is the ultimate.

original: gnod pa can med pa tsam la bye brag yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: gnod pa can med pa tsam la bye brag yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te ;
translated: The difference is that the latter is not contradicted.

original: shes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it included among the cognitions?

original: des na don du gnyer ba po yul rtogs pa tsam las 'jug pa yin gyi bye brag las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na don du gnyer ba po yul rtogs pa tsam las 'jug pa yin gyi bye brag las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who seeks engages in the object merely through understanding the object, not through the difference.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa la ni gnod pa can gyi shes pa gzhan nam /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa la ni gnod pa can gyi shes pa gzhan nam /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition, then it must depend on another cognition that contradicts it,

original: phyi rol gyi bye brag la ltos par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bye brag la ltos par bya ba yin na /
translated: or it must depend on an external difference.

original: 'di la yang de med pa ni bye brag yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di la yang de med pa ni bye brag yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not reasonable to say that the absence of that in this is the difference,

original: gsog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be a useless difference.

original: skyes pa'i dus nyid ni rnyed par sla ba nyid kyis ltos pa med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i dus nyid ni rnyed par sla ba nyid kyis ltos pa med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The time of its arising is independent because it is easily obtained.

original: skyes pa'i dus nyid na de med pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa la yang de yod pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i dus nyid na de med pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa la yang de yod pa yin te /
translated: The absence of that at the time of its arising exists even in a non-valid cognition.

original: phrad pa'i dus na yang skyes pa'i dus shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir gnod pa can yod pa bzhin du de med pa la yang the tshom za ba yin na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa'i dus na yang skyes pa'i dus shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir gnod pa can yod pa bzhin du de med pa la yang the tshom za ba yin na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: But when there is contact, the time of arising is not known, so there is doubt as to whether it exists or not, even when it is damaged. Those who are rational do not engage in it.

original: yul rtogs pa tsam las 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul rtogs pa tsam las 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does engagement come from merely understanding the object,

original: tshad ma ma yin pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that exists even in what is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: phrad par bya ba'i yul rtogs par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba'i yul rtogs par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the object to be contacted is to be understood,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de sngar rang gi dus 'dzin pa las 'byung ba yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de sngar rang gi dus 'dzin pa las 'byung ba yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it arises from previously apprehending its own time,

original: mngon sum ni yod bzhin pa la dmigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni yod bzhin pa la dmigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because direct perception observes what exists.

original: des na yang dngul du 'dzin pa ni yun ring po gnas pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'di ni legs par smras pa ma yin @28b no ;
analyzed: des na yang dngul du 'dzin pa ni yun ring po gnas pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'di ni legs par smras pa ma yin @28b no ;
translated: Therefore, it is not well said that the apprehension of silver is the apprehension of long-lastingness.

original: / phrad par bya ba dang rang gi ngo bo dag la gcig pa nyid du zhen pa yod kyang /
analyzed: / phrad par bya ba dang rang gi ngo bo dag la gcig pa nyid du zhen pa yod kyang /
translated: Even though there is attachment to identity between the object to be contacted and its own nature,

original: de ni de dag gi 'bras bu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: de ni de dag gi 'bras bu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: That is the reason why they are effects of those.

original: de shes na 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'di lta bu'i yul rtogs pa las 'jig rten pa 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de shes na 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'di lta bu'i yul rtogs pa las 'jig rten pa 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: Because when one knows that, one engages in the object, one engages in the object by knowing that it is the effect of that.

original: khyed kyis smras pa'i rtogs pa tsam las 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyis smras pa'i rtogs pa tsam las 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But one does not engage in the object by mere knowledge as you have stated.

original: rig byed la ni de mi srid do //
analyzed: rig byed la ni de mi srid do //
translated: That is not possible for the Vedas.

original: dbang po'i yul las 'das pa nyid kyis phrad par bya ba'i 'bras bu nyid mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul las 'das pa nyid kyis phrad par bya ba'i 'bras bu nyid mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not know that it is the effect of the contact of the sense faculty and object, since it is beyond the range of the sense faculties.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni rtags de'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa las rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni rtags de'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa las rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: In inference, one understands the object by knowing that the reason is its effect.

original: yang na 'di'i dpe nye bar dgod pa ni dper na rtogs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa yang khyab ches pa'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di'i dpe nye bar dgod pa ni dper na rtogs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa yang khyab ches pa'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Or else, the example is stated here: Just as mere knowledge is not valid cognition, in the same way, unimpaired knowledge is also not valid cognition, because it is too broad.

original: dper na rtogs pa tsam ni rab tu sbyor bar byed pa ma yin zhing mngon par 'dod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na rtogs pa tsam ni rab tu sbyor bar byed pa ma yin zhing mngon par 'dod pa ma yin la /
translated: For example, mere understanding is not a means of valid cognition and is not what is desired.

original: de bzhin du gnod pa med pa nyid kyang skyes bu'i don ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod pa med pa nyid kyang skyes bu'i don ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, mere nondeceptiveness is not a means of valid cognition because it is not a human goal.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams rab tu sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams rab tu sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that those who have understanding do not employ nondeceptiveness as a means of valid cognition is as follows:

original: rtogs pa tsam dang 'brel pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam dang 'brel pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe connection with mere understanding . . .‚Äù

original: de yang mtshungs pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di yang rab tu sbyor bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di la ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang mtshungs pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di yang rab tu sbyor bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di la ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is also similar. This also should be understood in terms of ‚Äúnot being a means of valid cognition.‚Äù

original: rab tu sbyor bar byed pa nyid ma yin du zin kyang khyab ches pa nyid ji ltar yin /
analyzed: rab tu sbyor bar byed pa nyid ma yin du zin kyang khyab ches pa nyid ji ltar yin /
translated: Even if it is not a means of valid cognition, how is it that it is too broad?

original: gnod pa med pa rtogs pa ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa rtogs pa ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: An understanding that is nondeceptive is a means of valid cognition.

original: dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gnod pa can yin la /
analyzed: dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gnod pa can yin la /
translated: The consciousness of silver and so on is deceptive.

original: phyis 'di ma yin no zhes pa las /
analyzed: phyis 'di ma yin no zhes pa las /
translated: Later, when it is said, ‚ÄúThis is not silver,‚ÄùüîΩ. . .

original: de'i 'og tu yang nya phyis su ste de rnams las kyang bar mas dang po bsal nas tha mar nya phyis kyi shes pa nges par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang nya phyis su ste de rnams las kyang bar mas dang po bsal nas tha mar nya phyis kyi shes pa nges par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Then, after that, the oyster is removed.üîΩThe consciousness of the oyster does not ascertain the first silver, having removed the middle one.

original: nya phyis kyi shes pas kyang dang po'i dngul du shes pa bsal nas /üîΩbar ma 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nya phyis kyi shes pas kyang dang po'i dngul du shes pa bsal nas / bar ma 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: And the consciousness of silver does not ascertain the middle one, having removed the consciousness of silver.

original: des na phan tshun bsten pa ma yin no //üîΩde yang / re zhig tha mas dang po gnyis//
analyzed: des na phan tshun bsten pa ma yin no // de yang / re zhig tha mas dang po gnyis//
translated: Therefore, they are not mutually dependent.üîΩMoreover,üîΩthe last one first removes the first two,

original: bar mas de bzhin thog mtha' dag / yongs gcod dang po bsal nas ni //
analyzed: bar mas de bzhin thog mtha' dag / yongs gcod dang po bsal nas ni //
translated: and the middle one likewise the first and last.

original: tha ma tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha ma tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Having removed the first, the last is valid knowledge.

original: zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes smos pa'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: yang 'di rnams las gang la gnod par bya ba yin /
analyzed: yang 'di rnams las gang la gnod par bya ba yin /
translated: Moreover, what is it that is to be invalidated among these?

original: 'jug pa'i ngo bo 'bras bu la'o /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i ngo bo 'bras bu la'o /
translated: The nature of engagement is in regard to the result.

original: 'bras bu la ci zhig byas pa las gnod par byed @29a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ci zhig byas pa las gnod par byed @29a * //
translated: What is done to the result that is invalidated?

original: pa yin / gal te de byas pas gzhan gyis de la ci byar yod /
analyzed: pa yin / gal te de byas pas gzhan gyis de la ci byar yod /
translated: If it is done by that, what can the other do to it?

original: shing la sogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'bar ba la sogs par snang la 'bar ba la sogs pa de las gzhan btsal bar bya bar 'gyur bar thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'bar ba la sogs par snang la 'bar ba la sogs pa de las gzhan btsal bar bya bar 'gyur bar thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fire, etc., that appears in the wood, etc., would be sought as something other than that, and there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu la gnod pa byed pa kho na gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu la gnod pa byed pa kho na gnod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, only the harm to the effect is the harm.üîΩAnd that is stated:

original: de yang / shes pa snga ma'i 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: de yang / shes pa snga ma'i 'bras bu ni //
translated: The effect of the prior cognition

original: rnam gcod phyi ma gnod byed yin //
analyzed: rnam gcod phyi ma gnod byed yin //
translated: is harmed by the subsequent determination.

original: 'bras bu 'joms pa gnod byed pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'joms pa gnod byed pa //
translated: The harm is the destruction of the effect,

original: yin gyi khyad par can gzhan min //üîΩzhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: yin gyi khyad par can gzhan min // zhes smos pa'o //
translated: not some other special thing.

original: yang yul 'phrog pa ni ma yin te de mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang yul 'phrog pa ni ma yin te de mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the object is not stolen, because that is not possible.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩ'das pa yang ni yul las kyang //
analyzed: de skad du yang / 'das pa yang ni yul las kyang //
translated: And it is stated:üîΩThe past is also not able to

original: rnam gcod nyid ni nus min te //
analyzed: rnam gcod nyid ni nus min te //
translated: determine the object.

original: rkun pos nor blangs nas byed ba //
analyzed: rkun pos nor blangs nas byed ba //
translated: When a thief takes the wealth and goes away,

original: de las dbrog par su yis nus //üîΩzhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: de las dbrog par su yis nus // zhes smos pa'o //
translated: who can take it away from him?

original: yang yul nges pa ni 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: yang yul nges pa ni 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: Moreover, the determination of the object is the reason for engagement.

original: rgyu mtshan la gnod pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan la gnod pa med pa yin na /
translated: And if the reason is not harmed,

original: ji ltar de la gnod par byed pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar de la gnod par byed pa yin /
translated: How does it harm it?üîΩIt is taught that the object is stolen by the object‚Äôs being capable of producing a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent, and not by anything else.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is not seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.üîΩThe consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.

original: 'das pa'i yul med pa yang shes par byed par nus pa nyid kyi phyir yul 'phrog pa nyid gnod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni sad pa'i shes pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i yul med pa yang shes par byed par nus pa nyid kyi phyir yul 'phrog pa nyid gnod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni sad pa'i shes pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.

original: bye brag ma mthong ba las nya phyis la dngul gyi shes pa skyes pa yin la /üîΩde la gnod par byed pa ni bye brag tu 'dzin pa can yin no ;
analyzed: bye brag ma mthong ba las nya phyis la dngul gyi shes pa skyes pa yin la / de la gnod par byed pa ni bye brag tu 'dzin pa can yin no ;
translated: The consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.üîΩThe consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.üîΩThe consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.

original: / de yang nya phyis kyi shes pa dang / 'og tu yang de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa can 'di ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi shes pa'i rim pa yin pas pha rol smra ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /üîΩgnod pa zhes bya ba 'di ni ci zhig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: / de yang nya phyis kyi shes pa dang / 'og tu yang de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa can 'di ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi shes pa'i rim pa yin pas pha rol smra ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni / gnod pa zhes bya ba 'di ni ci zhig ces bya ba ste /
translated: The consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.üîΩThe consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.üîΩThe consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.üîΩThe consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as existent.

original: yul 'phrog par nus pa yin na /
analyzed: yul 'phrog par nus pa yin na /
translated: The consciousness that perceives the object as distinct from silver is a consciousness that perceives the object as nonexistent.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a mother-of-pearl that is seen as distinct from silver is a consciousness

original: de nyid gnod pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di la gal te gzhan gyi yul med par zhes bya ba smos pa la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gnod pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di la gal te gzhan gyi yul med par zhes bya ba smos pa la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: If the opponent says that the cognition of mother of pearl is not a valid cognition because it is mistaken, then the cognition of mother of pearl is not a valid cognition because it is mistaken with respect to its object, but it is not a valid cognition because it is mistaken with respect to another object.

original: nya phyis kyi shes pa ni rang gi yul gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa la 'jug pa yin gyi gzhan du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nya phyis kyi shes pa ni rang gi yul gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa la 'jug pa yin gyi gzhan du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of mother of pearl is engaged in apprehending the nature of its own object, but it does not do so with respect to another.

original: de yongs su gcod cing de las gzhan pa rnam par gcod pa ni rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yongs su gcod cing de las gzhan pa rnam par gcod pa ni rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is a cognition that eliminates that and eliminates what is other than that.

original: shes pa thams cad de lta bu yin pa'i phyir thams cad gnod pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad de lta bu yin pa'i phyir thams cad gnod pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: But because all cognitions are like that, all would be invalid.

original: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa'i gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa nyid ni med pa yin la de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa'i gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa nyid ni med pa yin la de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the ultimate object of refutation and the ultimate refuting cognition do not exist. Because they do not exist,

original: gnod @29b pa med pa can nyid kyang ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis khyab ches pa gsal bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod @29b pa med pa can nyid kyang ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis khyab ches pa gsal bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: there is no such thing as an invalid cognition. This clearly shows that the pervasion is too wide.

original: gal te 'dod pa dang phrad pa la nye bar sbyor ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa nyid nges par khas blangs pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa dang phrad pa la nye bar sbyor ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa nyid nges par khas blangs pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.

original: de yang gnas pa ste mi g-yo ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni 'di ni don byed pa rnam par gnas pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gnas pa ste mi g-yo ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni 'di ni don byed pa rnam par gnas pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.

original: gnod pa med pa tsam nyid ni thug pa med pa'i phyir mi srid pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni gnod pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'o //üîΩ'on te gnod pa med pa yin na /üîΩdon la nges pa skyed pa'i tshad ma nyid la 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa tsam nyid ni thug pa med pa'i phyir mi srid pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni gnod pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'o // 'on te gnod pa med pa yin na / don la nges pa skyed pa'i tshad ma nyid la 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin nam /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.

original: de la yang gang gi tshe dmigs kyis bsal bar dogs pa de'i tshe snga ma las bzlog pa'i don 'dzin pa can gyi shes pa gzhan ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: de la yang gang gi tshe dmigs kyis bsal bar dogs pa de'i tshe snga ma las bzlog pa'i don 'dzin pa can gyi shes pa gzhan ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object‚Äù teaches that it is not a valid cognition that ascertains the object.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit is not a valid cognition

original: de la yang dogs pa yod na shes pa bar mas bzung ba'i don las bzlog pa 'dzin pa can gyi shes pa gsum pa de nyid las snga ma tshad ma nyid du nges pas 'di tsam gyis tha snyad brjod pa'i phyir shes pa gzhan btsal bar bya ba
analyzed: de la yang dogs pa yod na shes pa bar mas bzung ba'i don las bzlog pa 'dzin pa can gyi shes pa gsum pa de nyid las snga ma tshad ma nyid du nges pas 'di tsam gyis tha snyad brjod pa'i phyir shes pa gzhan btsal bar bya ba
translated: If there is doubt about that, then the third cognition, which is the opposite of the object held by the middle cognition, is the apprehender. Since the former is ascertained as valid knowledge, this much is expressed in conventional terms, so another cognition is not to be sought.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: And that is stated:

original: de yang / de ltar rtogs byed shes pa ni //
analyzed: de yang / de ltar rtogs byed shes pa ni //
translated: The cognition that realizes in that way

original: gsum char gsal ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gsum char gsal ba ma yin te //
translated: is not clear in all three cases.

original: de phyir gnod pa skye min pa'ang //
analyzed: de phyir gnod pa skye min pa'ang //
translated: Therefore, it is not that there is no arising of impairment,

original: gnod pa can du'ang dogs bya min //
analyzed: gnod pa can du'ang dogs bya min //
translated: nor is it that there is doubt about impairment.

original: zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes smos pa'o //
translated: Why is it said:üîΩ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?üîΩBecause in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.üîΩWhy is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?

original: gnod pa can la yang gnod pa can du snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa can la yang gnod pa can du snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.

original: gnod pa can du'ang dogs bya min //
analyzed: gnod pa can du'ang dogs bya min //
translated: Why is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?üîΩBecause in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.

original: zhes ci'i phyir smras she na /
analyzed: zhes ci'i phyir smras she na /
translated: Why is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?üîΩBecause in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.üîΩWhy is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?üîΩBecause in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.üîΩWhy is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?üîΩBecause in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.üîΩWhy is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?üîΩBecause in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.üîΩWhy is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?üîΩBecause in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.üîΩWhy is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?üîΩBecause in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.üîΩWhy is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?

original: rang nyid gang la the tshom skyes pa de la ni shes pa gzhan las ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang nyid gang la the tshom skyes pa de la ni shes pa gzhan las ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: Because in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.üîΩWhy is it said: ‚ÄúNor is it that there is doubt about impairment‚Äù?

original: gang la ma skyes pa de la ni nan gyis bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la ma skyes pa de la ni nan gyis bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because in the case of impairment, there is the appearance of impairment.

original: gzhan dag na re nan gyis kyang bskyed par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nan gyis kyang bskyed par bya ba yin te /
translated: Others say: It is also generated through force.

original: de yang shes pa gsum bzhi skyes bzhin pa tsam las ldog par gzhan du mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: de yang shes pa gsum bzhi skyes bzhin pa tsam las ldog par gzhan du mthong ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is seen that it is stopped merely through the arising of three or four consciousnesses.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, it would be stopped here,

original: de kho na bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen in the same way.

original: ma skyes pa la'ang gnod pa can //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la'ang gnod pa can //
translated: Also, it is stopped by the nonarising of the object of doubt.

original: tshol ba'i rmongs pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: tshol ba'i rmongs pa gang yin pa //
translated: The confusion of searching for the object of doubt

original: de ni tha snyad thams cad la //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad thams cad la //
translated: is stopped in all conventions

original: yid gnyis ngo bo zad de 'gro //üîΩzhes bya ba dang / kun ta'i bu rnams the tshom dang // bcas la 'jig rten 'di dang gzhan //
analyzed: yid gnyis ngo bo zad de 'gro // zhes bya ba dang / kun ta'i bu rnams the tshom dang // bcas la 'jig rten 'di dang gzhan //
translated: and the nature of doubt is exhausted.üîΩThe sons of Kunti, who have doubtüîΩand say, ‚ÄúThere is no this world or another,‚Äù

original: med ces the tshom bdag nyid can //
analyzed: med ces the tshom bdag nyid can //
translated: are of the nature of doubt

original: khyab 'jug gis ni smad pa yin //üîΩzhes smos pa'o //üîΩrang gi ngo bo rang gis rig pas @30a * //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gis ni smad pa yin // zhes smos pa'o // rang gi ngo bo rang gis rig pas @30a * //
translated: and are despised by Vishnu.

original: phrad par bya ba dang 'brel ba can rang gis rig pas tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phrad par bya ba dang 'brel ba can rang gis rig pas tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that valid knowledge is valid knowledge because it is self-awareness that is related to the object of contact.

original: shes pa la snang bzhin pa thams cad phyi rol nyid du shes pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ma yin la ma yin pa nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa la snang bzhin pa thams cad phyi rol nyid du shes pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ma yin la ma yin pa nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: Because all that appears to consciousness is known as external, it is not its own nature, and it is ascertained as not being that.

original: phyi rol la yang kha cig la don med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol la yang kha cig la don med pa'i phyir /
translated: Even in the external, for some, due to the absence of an object,

original: nges dben pa'i don gyis dmigs kyis bsal bar dogs pa dang bral ba yin na rang nyid las yin no //
analyzed: nges dben pa'i don gyis dmigs kyis bsal bar dogs pa dang bral ba yin na rang nyid las yin no //
translated: there is freedom from doubt about being excluded by the object of ascertainment, but it is from itself.

original: phyi rol nyid du snang bzhin pa ni rang gi ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du snang bzhin pa ni rang gi ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: What appears as external is not its own nature,

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is too much.

original: dmigs kyis bsal bar dogs pa dang bral ba yin na /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal bar dogs pa dang bral ba yin na /
translated: If there is freedom from doubt about being excluded by the object of ascertainment,

original: shes par bya ba don ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba don ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: the object of cognition is not non-existent,

original: rang gi ngo bo la yang de bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la yang de bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow in the same way for its own nature.

original: de bzhin du shes par bya ba yang skad cig nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes par bya ba yang skad cig nyid ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the object of cognition is not momentary,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus 'gal ba med pa can nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus 'gal ba med pa can nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears as not having the contradiction of earlier and later times.

original: gnod pa can du dogs pa ldog pa la mi bslu ba rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa can du dogs pa ldog pa la mi bslu ba rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not that it is non-deceptive with regard to the reversal of the suspicion of harm,

original: gzhan nyid 'jig rten pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde yang / gnod pa can don gnyer ba la //
analyzed: gzhan nyid 'jig rten pa la yod pa'i phyir ro // de yang / gnod pa can don gnyer ba la //
translated: because the otherness exists in the world.üîΩAnd that is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúThe one who is suspicious of harm

original: gang zhig gang la ltos pa yin //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la ltos pa yin //
translated: in regard to the one who is desirous of an object,

original: yul dus mi yi gnas skabs kyi //
analyzed: yul dus mi yi gnas skabs kyi //
translated: the divisions of place, time, and person

original: dbye rnams tha snyad nyid la nges //üîΩzhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: dbye rnams tha snyad nyid la nges // zhes smos pa'o //
translated: are ascertained in mere convention.‚Äù

original: thag ring po na gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: thag ring po na gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is situated far away,

original: gang la ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba ma yin par dogs pa de la the tshom log pa'i mtshams srid du /
analyzed: gang la ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba ma yin par dogs pa de la the tshom log pa'i mtshams srid du /
translated: there is a possibility of the reversal of doubt in regard to that which is suspected of not being seen as it is.

original: thag nye bar phyin pa nyid yin gyi dus gzhan la sogs pa la sdod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thag nye bar phyin pa nyid yin gyi dus gzhan la sogs pa la sdod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is situated at another time, etc.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the cognition of a mirage, etc.

original: de bzhin du dmag gi dus su ba lang ngam rta la sogs par the tshom za ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmag gi dus su ba lang ngam rta la sogs par the tshom za ba'am /
translated: In the same way, in the case of an army, the one who is suspicious or mistaken in regard to an ox or a horse, etc.,

original: 'khrul pa gang yin pa de la nges par gsal bar 'gyur ba ni mtshams yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa gang yin pa de la nges par gsal bar 'gyur ba ni mtshams yin no //
translated: that one is ascertained and clarified.

original: mtshan mo srin po me khyer yang //
analyzed: mtshan mo srin po me khyer yang //
translated: At night, even fireflies

original: me dang 'dra ba kun gyis mthong //
analyzed: me dang 'dra ba kun gyis mthong //
translated: are seen by everyone as if they were fire.

original: nyin mo gsal bar mthong nyid kyis //
analyzed: nyin mo gsal bar mthong nyid kyis //
translated: But in the daytime, because they are clearly seen,

original: 'khrul pa yin par go ba yin //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin par go ba yin //
translated: they are understood to be mistaken.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: zla ba gnyis dang phyogs rmongs dang // rig byed yi ge dbyangs sogs rnams //üîΩskyes bu gzhan la legs dris las //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis dang phyogs rmongs dang // rig byed yi ge dbyangs sogs rnams // skyes bu gzhan la legs dris las //
translated: the two moons, the confusion of directions, the sounds of the Vedas, the letters, the vowels, and so on,üîΩare ascertained to be different

original: gzhan pa nyid du nges 'dzin 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du nges 'dzin 'gyur //
translated: from other things by asking other people.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang myos dang smyo //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang myos dang smyo //
translated: Attachment, anger, intoxication,

original: bkres skom sogs kyis dbang nyams pas //üîΩshes bya don la log rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: bkres skom sogs kyis dbang nyams pas // shes bya don la log rtogs pa'i //
translated: and the loss of control due to hunger, thirst, and so on,üîΩare not mistaken

original: phyin ci log rnams med pas so //üîΩde bzhin phra ba bskor @30b ba las //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams med pas so // de bzhin phra ba bskor @30b ba las //
translated: because they are not mistaken about the objects of knowledge.üîΩIn the same way, the confusion

original: 'dra ba sogs rnams la 'khrul nyid //
analyzed: 'dra ba sogs rnams la 'khrul nyid //
translated: of the double moon and so on is due to the fault of the sense faculty.

original: rgyu yi phyin ci log gyur las //
analyzed: rgyu yi phyin ci log gyur las //
translated: From the error of the cause,

original: gzhan pa nyid du nges 'dzin 'gyur //üîΩde ltar rgyu yi skyon rnams su //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du nges 'dzin 'gyur // de ltar rgyu yi skyon rnams su //
translated: it is ascertained to be different.üîΩThus, whatever is understood

original: gang zhig gang la rtogs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la rtogs 'gyur ba //
translated: in terms of the faults of the cause,üîΩthat very thing is ascertained

original: de nyid yod dang med pa las //
analyzed: de nyid yod dang med pa las //
translated: as existent or nonexistent.

original: de la bden dang brdzun blo dag / ces bya bar dogs pa la /üîΩdang po gnod pa med pa ni //
analyzed: de la bden dang brdzun blo dag / ces bya bar dogs pa la / dang po gnod pa med pa ni //
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúHow can one know the truth or falsity of that?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFirst, the nonerroneous . . .‚Äù

original: de nyams su myong ba'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa yin gyi /
translated: The nature of that experience is known.

original: gzhan yang rig par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rig par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not known by another.

original: rig pa med pa'am gzhan rig par bya ba nyams su myong ba yin na don rig pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa med pa'am gzhan rig par bya ba nyams su myong ba yin na don rig pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the experience of the absence of awareness or the experience of the awareness of another were the awareness of an object, it would follow, absurdly, that awareness would not be awareness of an object.

original: nyams su myong ba rig pa ni don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba rig pa ni don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The awareness of an experience is the understanding of an object.

original: nyams su myong ba'i don rig par ji skad bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i don rig par ji skad bstan pa ste /
translated: The awareness of an object that is experienced is as I have explained.

original: don gyis shes pa ni blo sgrub par byed pa khas len pa yin gyi blo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don gyis shes pa ni blo sgrub par byed pa khas len pa yin gyi blo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The awareness of an object is the proof of the existence of awareness, not the other way around.

original: dbang po'i bya ba dang de'i nye bar zhi ba dag gi bar gyi gnas skabs gang yin pa ni nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba dang de'i nye bar zhi ba dag gi bar gyi gnas skabs gang yin pa ni nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: The state that is between the functioning of the sense organ and its cessation is the experience.

original: de la tha dad pa ma yin pa nyams su myong ba'i rang gi ngo bo la ni dbye ba med pa'i phyir the tshom za ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa ma yin pa nyams su myong ba'i rang gi ngo bo la ni dbye ba med pa'i phyir the tshom za ba ma yin la /
translated: Since the nature of the experience of non-difference is undifferentiated, there is no doubt.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni 'gyur ro //
translated: But if there is difference, there is doubt.

original: byung bar gyur pa yang tshad ma gzhan gyis ldog par byed pa yin na mi rigs te bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa yang tshad ma gzhan gyis ldog par byed pa yin na mi rigs te bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if the occurrence of the object is refuted by another valid cognition, that is not right, because there is no difference.

original: de nyid kyi de ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gsal bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi de ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gsal bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: And that is not capable of manifesting itself, like its own nature,

original: rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not its own nature.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyis long la thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyis long la thob pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is obtained by all beings, like the nature of the self.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang phrad par bya ba dag rang nyid las nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang phrad par bya ba dag rang nyid las nges pa yin no //
translated: And the objects to be contacted by one's own nature are ascertained from themselves.

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa sgrub par byed pa la 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa sgrub par byed pa la 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
translated: Direct perception and non-apprehension are unmistaken in establishing.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa can nyid kyi yul dang dus dang ming dang gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ci nas kyang tha dad par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni phrad par bya ba dang 'brel pa can nyid kyi yul dang dus dang ming dang gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ci nas kyang tha dad par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Its own nature is not at all differentiated by the distinctions of place, time, name, and occasion, which are connected with what is to be contacted.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that there be no external objects,

original: de ni phrad par bya ba dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar shin tu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phrad par bya ba dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar shin tu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not at all seen to be dissimilar from what is to be contacted.

original: phrad par bya ba yang rang nyid rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad par bya ba yang rang nyid rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And what is to be contacted is itself to be known.

original: de'i phyir phyi'i don du smra ba la nam yang the tshom ldog pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi'i don du smra ba la nam yang the tshom ldog pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, for those who advocate external objects, doubt never ceases,

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmed ces the tshom bdag nyid can //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // med ces the tshom bdag nyid can //
translated: because there is no certainty.üîΩThe one who is doubtful,

original: khyab 'jug gis ni smad pa yin //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gis ni smad pa yin //
translated: is condemned by Vishnu.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang dad pa tsam @31a * //üîΩgyi rtsa ba can yin gyi /
